  4397                                          	jmp	short startmsg_nxt_chr
  4398                                  
  4399                                  ;flp_drvs:	db  0 	; 27/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4400                                  
  4401                                  startmsg_ok:
  4402                                  
  4403                                  %endif
  4404                                  
  4405                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4406                                  ; initialization - stage 2
  4407                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4408                                  ; 20/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (combined kernel)
  4409                                  
  4410                                  
  4411                                  ; 19/03/2018
  4412                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 (24/02/2018)
  4413                                  ; [REF: MSDOS 3.3, MSBIO, "MSINIT.ASM"  (24/07/1987)]
  4414                                  
  4415                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4416                                  ;									:
  4417                                  ;	System initialization						:
  4418                                  ;									:
  4419                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  4420                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  4421                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  4422                                  ;									:
  4423                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  4424                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  4425                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  4426                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  4427                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  4428                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  4429                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  4430                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  4431                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  4432                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  4433                                  ;		this program.						:
  4434                                  ;									:
  4435                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4436                                  		
  4437                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4438                                  		; ----------------------
  4439                                  		; Registers
  4440                                  		; ----------------------
  4441                                  		; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4442                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4443                                  		; DS = 0, ES = 0, SS = 0
  4444                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4445                                  		; SP = 700h
  4446                                  		; ----------------------
  4447                                  		; CX = 0				
  4448                                  
  4449                                  ; 02/10/2022 - 20/12/2022
  4450                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4451                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4452                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4453                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4454                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4455                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 70h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4456                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector and then MSLOAD sets this).
  4457                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4458                                  
  4459                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4460                                  ;
  4461                                  ;;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4462                                  ;;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4463                                  ;;	data sector of the bios.
  4464                                  ;
  4465                                  ;		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4466                                  ;		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4467                                  
  4468                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4469                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4470                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4471                                  
  4472                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4473 000015F1 FA                      		cli
  4474                                  
  4475 000015F2 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4476 000015F3 07                      		pop	es
  4477                                  		;push	cx
  4478                                  		;push	di
  4479                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4480 000015F4 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4481                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4482                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4483                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4484 000015F6 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4485                                  next_int_:		
  4486 000015F9 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4487 000015FA AC                      		lodsb		
  4488                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4489 000015FB 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4490 000015FC D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4491 000015FE D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4492 00001600 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4493 00001602 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4494                                  					; saving address in di
  4495                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4496                                  		;stosw
  4497                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4498                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4499                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4500 00001604 A5                      		movsw
  4501 00001605 A5                      		movsw		
  4502                                  
  4503 00001606 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4504 00001608 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4505                                  		
  4506                                  		;pop	di
  4507                                  		;pop	cx
  4508                                  
  4509                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4510                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4511                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4512                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4513                                  
  4514                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4515                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4516                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4517                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4518                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4519                                  
  4520                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4521 0000160A C7064C00[ED06]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4522                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4523                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4524 00001610 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4525                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4526 00001614 C7065400[9907]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4527                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4528                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4529 0000161A 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4530                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4531 0000161E C7066400[5907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4532                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4533                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4534 00001624 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4535                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4536                                  
  4537                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4538 00001628 0E                      		push	cs
  4539 00001629 1F                      		pop	ds
  4540                                  		
  4541 0000162A A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4542 0000162D A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4543 00001630 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4544 00001633 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4545                                  					; ;
  4546 00001636 FB                      		sti
  4547 00001637 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4548                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4549                                  
  4550                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4551                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4552                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4553                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4554                                  ;
  4555                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4556                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4557                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4558                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4559                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4560                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4561                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4562                                  
  4563                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4564                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4565                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4566                                  ;
  4567                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4568                                  ; to do anything special.
  4569                                  ;
  4570                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4571                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4572                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4573                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4574                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4575                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4576                                  
  4577                                  		; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4578 00001639 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  4579                                  
  4580                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4581 0000163B A801                    		test	al, 1
  4582                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4583 0000163D 751F                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4584                                  
  4585                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4586                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4587                                  ;
  4588                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4589                                  ;
  4590                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4591                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4592                                  
  4593                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4594                                  		;push	ax
  4595                                  		;push	bx
  4596                                  		;push	cx
  4597 0000163F 52                      		push	dx
  4598                                  		;push	di
  4599 00001640 06                      		push	es
  4600 00001641 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4601 00001643 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4602 00001645 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4603                                  					; DL = drive number
  4604                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4605                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4606                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4607 00001647 7202                    		jc	short _gdskp_error
  4608                                  		;;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4609                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4610                                  		; ds = cs
  4611                                  		;mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4612 00001649 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  4613                                  _gdskp_error:	
  4614                                  		; 20/12/2022			
  4615 0000164B 07                      		pop	es
  4616                                  		;pop	di
  4617 0000164C 5A                      		pop	dx
  4618                                  		;pop	cx
  4619                                  		;pop	bx
  4620                                  		;pop	ax
  4621                                  		
  4622 0000164D 720F                    		jc	short normalfloppydrv
  4623                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4624                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4625                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4626                                  		; ds = cs
  4627                                  		;cmp	byte [flp_drvs], 0
  4628                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4629                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4630                                  		;;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4631                                  		;mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4632                                  		;;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4633                                  		;; 18/12/2022
  4634                                  		;dec	ax
  4635                                  		;jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4636                                  		
  4637                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4638 0000164F 08C9                    		or	cl, cl ; [flp_drvs]
  4639 00001651 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv		
  4640 00001653 49                      		dec	cx	
  4641 00001654 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4642                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4643                                  
  4644                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4645                                  		;20/12/2022
  4646                                  		; ds = cs
  4647 00001656 FEC1                    		inc	cl	; cl = 1
  4648 00001658 880E[2315]              		mov	[fakefloppydrv], cl ; 1
  4649                                  		;mov	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1		
  4650                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4651                                  					; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4652                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4653                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4654 0000165C EB0A                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4655                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4656                                  
  4657                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4658                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4659                                  		;rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4660                                  		;rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4661 0000165E D0C1                    		rol	cl, 1
  4662 00001660 D0C1                    		rol	cl, 1
  4663                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4664                                  		;;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4665                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4666                                  		;and	al, 3
  4667                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4668 00001662 80E103                  		and	cl, 3
  4669 00001665 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4670                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4671 00001667 41                      		inc	cx
  4672                                  		;inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4673                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4674                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4675                                  		; ds = cs
  4676 00001668 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4677                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4678                                  notsingle:	
  4679                                  		; 20/12/2022			
  4680                                  		;inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4681                                  		;			; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4682                                  		;			; booted off hard file
  4683                                  		;mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4684                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4685 0000166C FEC1                    		inc	cl	; cl >= 2
  4686                                  
  4687                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4688                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4689                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4690                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4691                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4692                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4693                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4694                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4695                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4696                                  
  4697                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4698                                  
  4699                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4700 0000166E 88C8                    		mov	al, cl	; 26/05/2019
  4701                                  
  4702 00001670 F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4703 00001673 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4704 00001675 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4705                                  gothrd:					
  4706                                  
  4707                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  4708                                  ;   ax = 0-based drive we booted from
  4709                                  ;   bios_l, bios_h set.
  4710                                  ;   cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4711                                  ;   ch = media byte
  4712                                  
  4713                                  ; Retro DOS 4.0 - 27/12/2018 
  4714                                  ;  (from Retro DOS v2.0 boot sector)
  4715                                  ;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4716                                  ;   dh = media byte
  4717                                  
  4718                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4719 00001677 88F5                    		mov	ch, dh		; 01/07/2018
  4720                                  
  4721                                  		; cl = number of floppies
  4722                                  		; ch = media byte
  4723                                  
  4724                                  		; set up local stack
  4725                                  
  4726                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4727                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4728                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4729                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4730                                  					; ch = media byte
  4731                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4732                                  		; es = ds = cs
  4733                                  		; ss = 0
  4734                                  		; sp = 700h
  4735                                  
  4736                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4737                                  		;cli
  4738                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4739                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  4740                                  		;sti
  4741                                  
  4742 00001679 51                      		push	cx ; (***) 	; save number of floppies and media byte
  4743                                  		
  4744 0000167A 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4745 0000167C 50                      		push	ax ; (**)	; save boot drive number and media byte
  4746                                  		
  4747                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4748                                  
  4749 0000167D B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4750 0000167F CD15                    		int	15h	; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4751 00001681 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4752 00001683 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4753 00001686 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4754                                  
  4755                                  ;		; 20/12/2022
  4756                                  ;		; (Programmer's Guide to the AMIBIOS, page 268)
  4757                                  ;		; (https://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_15-c0.html)
  4758                                  ;
  4759                                  ;		INT 15h, ah = C0h - Return System Configuration Parameters (PS/2 only)
  4760                                  ;
  4761                                  ;		on return:
  4762                                  ;		CF = 0 if successful
  4763                                  ;		   = 1 if error
  4764                                  ;		AH = when CF set, 80h for PC & PCjr, 86h for XT
  4765                                  ;	     	    (BIOS after 11/8/82) and AT (BIOS after 1/10/84)
  4766                                  ;
  4767                                  ;		ES:BX = pointer to system descriptor table in ROM of the format:
  4768                                  ;
  4769                                  ;		Offset Size	     Description
  4770                                  ;
  4771                                  ;		  00   word   length of descriptor (8 minimum)
  4772                                  ;		  02   byte   model byte (same as F000:FFFE, not reliable)
  4773                                  ;		  03   byte   secondary model byte
  4774                                  ;		  04   byte   BIOS revision level (zero based)
  4775                                  ;		  05   byte   feature information, see below
  4776                                  ;		  06   dword  reserved
  4777                                  
  4778                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4779                                  		; ds = cs
  4780 00001688 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4781 0000168C A2[AF05]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4782                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4783                                  					; get/save model byte
  4784 0000168F 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]
  4785 00001693 A2[B005]                		mov	[secondary_model_byte], al
  4786                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  4787                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  4788 00001696 EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  4789                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4790                                  
  4791                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  4792 00001698 BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  4793 0000169B 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  4794                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4795 0000169D 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  4796 000016A1 A2[AF05]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4797                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  4798                                  turn_timer_on:				
  4799 000016A4 B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  4800 000016A6 E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.
  4801                                  					; AKPORT
  4802                                  
  4803                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  4804                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running
  4805                                  ; on one of those, we must inhibit the normal aux port initialization
  4806                                  
  4807                                  		; 20/12/2022
  4808                                  		; ds = cs
  4809 000016A8 803E[AF05]00            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0
  4810                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0 ; next to last	byte in	rom bios
  4811 000016AD 7510                    		jnz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; skip for all other machines
  4812                                  					; (except olivetti m24)
  4813 000016AF E466                    		in	al, 66h		; is 8530 installed?
  4814 000016B1 A820                    		test	al, 20h
  4815 000016B3 740A                    		jz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; we're done if not
  4816 000016B5 B00F                    		mov	al, 0Fh		; double check
  4817 000016B7 E650                    		out	50h, al
  4818 000016B9 E450                    		in	al, 50h
  4819 000016BB A801                    		test	al, 1		; this test was	copied from olivetti
  4820 000016BD 7414                    		jz	short skip_aux_port_init ; take	this branch if 8530 installed
  4821                                  
  4822                                  not_olivetti_m24:
  4823 000016BF B003                    		mov	al, 3		; init com4
  4824 000016C1 E84608                  		call	aux_init
  4825 000016C4 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init com3
  4826 000016C6 E84108                  		call	aux_init
  4827 000016C9 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init com2
  4828 000016CB E83C08                  		call	aux_init
  4829 000016CE 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; init com1
  4830 000016D0 E83708                  		call	aux_init
  4831

  4893                                  ;		50:12	dword	Pointer to BASIC INT 1C interrupt handler

  5156                                  
  5157                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of
  5158                                  ; diskette drives:
  5159                                  ;
  5160                                  ;   48tpi drives    we do nothing special for them
  5161                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5162                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.
  5163                                  ;
  5164                                  ; the following code uses registers for certain values:
  5165                                  ;
  5166                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5167                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds
  5168                                  ;   cx - flag bits for bds
  5169                                  ;   dh - form factor for the drive (1 - 48tpi, 2 - 96tpi, 3 - 3.5" medium)
  5170                                  					
  5171 000017E1 30D2                    		xor	dl, dl
  5172                                  
  5173                                  		; 20/12/2022
  5174                                  		; ds = cs
  5175                                  		; 17/06/2018

  5180 000017E8 BF[1901]                		mov	di, start_bds 	; if we	are faking floppy drives we need
  5181                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5182                                  
  5183                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5184                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5185                                  
  5186                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5187                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5188                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5189                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5190                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5191                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5192                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5193                                  ; the bds for harddrives.
  5194                                  
  5195 000017EB 803E[2315]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1

  5197 000017F2 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5198                                  					; di <-	first bds link
  5199 000017F4 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5200                                  					; di <-	second bds link
  5201 000017F6 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; -1 ; set end of link
  5202 000017FA E90F01                  		jmp	dohard		; allocate/initialise bds for harddrives

  5226 00001815 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5227 00001817 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5228                                  					; DL = drive number
  5229                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5230                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5231                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5232 00001819 7276                    		jc	short noparmsfromrom
  5233                                  
  5234                                  ; if cmos is bad, it gives es,ax,bx,cx,dh,di=0. cy=0.
  5235                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  5236                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  5237                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic
  5238                                  ; diskette which need msbio,msdos to boot up before it sets cmos.
  5239                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.

  5498                                  ; than two diskette drives

  5501                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5502                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5503                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5504                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5518                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5519                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5520                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5521                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5522                                  ;
  5523                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5524                                  ;
  5525                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5526                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5527                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5528                                  ;use to start with.
  5529                                  ;
  5530                                  ;secondly, "dynamic configuration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5531                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5532                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5533                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5534                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5535

  5603                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5604                                  
  5605                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5606                                  ;
  5607                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5608                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5609                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5610                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5611                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5612                                  ; off of it.
  5613                                  ;
  5614                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5615                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5616                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5617                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5618                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5619                                  
  5620                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5621                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5622                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5623                                  		; 20/12/2022
  5624                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5625                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5626                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5627                                  
  5628                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5629 000019B1 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5630                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5631 000019B8 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5632 000019BA 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5633                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  5634 000019C1 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5635 000019C3 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  5636                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  5637 000019CA 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5638                                  
  5639                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  5640                                  
  5641 000019CC 26A1FBFF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFFBh]	; get year
  5642 000019D0 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5643 000019D2 3D3638                  		cmp	ax, 3836h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5644                                  		;cmp	ax, '86'        ; 3836h
  5645                                  					; is it	86?
  5646 000019D5 772E                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5647 000019D7 7218                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5648 000019D9 26A1F5FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF5h]	; get month
  5649 000019DD 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5650 000019DF 3D3830                  		cmp	ax, 3038h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5651                                  		;cmp	ax, '08'        ; 3038h
  5652                                  					; is it	08?
  5653 000019E2 7721                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5654 000019E4 720B                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch

  5930                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5931                                  ;
  5932                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5933                                  
  5934                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5935                                  
  5936                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5937                                  ; module name: remap
  5938                                  ;
  5939                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5940                                  ;
  5941                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5942                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5943                                  ;
  5944                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5945                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5946                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5947                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5948                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5949                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5950                                  
  5951                                  ; input:       none
  5952                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5953                                  ; exit error:  none
  5954                                  ; called from: msinit
  5955                                  ;
  5956                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5957                                  ;	  found in the system
  5958                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5959                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5960                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5961                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5962                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5963                                  ;
  5964                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5965                                  
  5966                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5967                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5968                                  
  5969                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5970 00001A47 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5971                                  
  5972                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5973                                  
  5974                                  drive_loop:				
  5975 00001A4C 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5976                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5977 00001A50 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5978 00001A52 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5979                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5980 00001A54 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5981 00001A57 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5982 00001A59 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5983                                  
  5984                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5985                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5986                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5987                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5988                                  
  5989                                  fdrv_found:				
  5990 00001A5B B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5991                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5992 00001A5D 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5993 00001A60 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5994                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5995                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5996                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5997 00001A62 40                      		inc	ax
  5998 00001A63 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ?
  5999 00001A66 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk drives
  6000                                  
  6001                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6002                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6003                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6004                                  ; any more.
  6005                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6006                                  
  6007 00001A68 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6008                                  					; get first bds
  6009 00001A6D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6010                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6011 00001A6F 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6012 00001A74 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6013                                  remap_loop1:				
  6014 00001A77 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6015                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6016 00001A79 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6017 00001A7C FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6018 00001A7E FECC                    		dec	ah		; count down extra floppies
  6019 00001A80 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6020                                  
  6021                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6022                                  
  6023 00001A82 2EA0[1A15]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6024 00001A86 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6025 00001A88 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6026 00001A8A 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6027 00001A8F 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6028                                  
  6029                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6030                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6031                                  
  6032 00001A91 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6033 00001A93 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6034                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6035                                  
  6036                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6037                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6038                                  
  6039                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6040 00001A95 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6041                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6042 00001A9A 2EA2[1A15]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6043 00001A9E FEC0                    		inc	al
  6044 00001AA0 1E                      		push	ds
  6045 00001AA1 BF2904                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6046                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6047 00001AA4 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6048 00001AA6 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6049                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6050                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6051 00001AA9 1F                      		pop	ds
  6052                                  rmap_exit:				
  6053 00001AAA C3                      		retn
  6054

  6058                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6059                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6060                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6061                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6062                                  ;**************************************************
  6063                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6064                                  ;
  6065                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6066                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6067                                  ;
  6068                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6069                                  ;**************************************************

  6072                                  bootbias equ 200h

  6074                                  getboot:	; proc near

  6078                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6079                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6080                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6081                                  
  6082 00001AAB 2EA1[1D15]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6083 00001AAF 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6084                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6085 00001AB1 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6086                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6087                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6088 00001AB4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6089 00001AB7 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6090 00001AB9 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6091 00001ABC CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6092                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6093                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6094                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6095 00001ABE 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6096                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6097 00001AC0 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6098                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6099                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6100 00001AC7 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6101                                  erret:					
  6102 00001AC9 F9                      		stc
  6103                                  norm_ret:				
  6104 00001ACA C3                      		retn
  6105                                  
  6106                                  
  6107                                  
  6108                                  ; 02/10/2023 - temporary
  6109 00001ACB 4E4F204E414D452020-     vol_no_name:	db 'NO NAME    ',0      
  6109 00001AD4 202000             
  6110 00001AD7 0000                    temp_h:		dw 0			; temporary for	32 bit calculation
  6111 00001AD9 03                      sm92:		db 3			; .spf			
  6112 00001ADA 09                      		db 9			; .spt
  6113 00001ADB 70                      		db 112	; 70h		; .cdire
  6114 00001ADC A005                    		dw 1440	; 2*9*80	; .csec
  6115 00001ADE 02                      		db 2			; .spau
  6116 00001ADF 02                      		db 2			; .chead
  6117                                  
  6118                                  
  6119                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6120                                  
  6121                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6122                                  
  6123                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6124                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6125                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6126                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6127                                  ;   determine version number
  6128                                  ;
  6129                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6130                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6131                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6132                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6133                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6134                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6135                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6136                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6137                                  
  6138                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6139                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6140                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6141 00001AE0 57                      		push	di
  6142 00001AE1 53                      		push	bx
  6143                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  6144 00001AE2 06                      		push	es
  6145 00001AE3 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6146 00001AE6 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6147 00001AE9 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6148                                  					; fnon_removable
  6149 00001AED C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6150                                  					; ffHardFile
  6151 00001AF1 C606[1C15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6152 00001AF6 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6153 00001AF8 52                      		push	dx
  6154 00001AF9 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6155 00001AFB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6156                                  					; DL = drive number
  6157                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6158                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6159                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6160 00001AFD FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6161 00001AFF 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6162 00001B02 5A                      		pop	dx
  6163 00001B03 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6164 00001B05 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6165 00001B08 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6166 00001B0B 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6167 00001B0C E89CFF                  		call	getboot
  6168 00001B0F 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6169 00001B10 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6170 00001B12 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6171                                  
  6172                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6173                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6174                                  
  6175                                  act_part:
  6176 00001B15 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6177 00001B1A 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6178 00001B1C 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6179 00001B20 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6180 00001B22 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6181 00001B26 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6182 00001B28 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6183 00001B2C 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6184                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  6185 00001B2E 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6186                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  6187 00001B30 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6188 00001B32 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6189                                  no_act:					
  6190 00001B34 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6191 00001B37 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6192                                  					; last entry done?
  6193 00001B3B 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6194 00001B3D BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6195                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6196                                  
  6197                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6198                                  
  6199                                  get_primary:
  6200 00001B40 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6201 00001B45 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6202                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6203 00001B47 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6204 00001B4B 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6205 00001B4D 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6206 00001B51 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6207 00001B53 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6208 00001B57 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6209                                  got_prim:
  6210 00001B59 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6211 00001B5B 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6212 00001B5D FECE                    		dec	dh
  6213                                  not_prim:
  6214 00001B5F 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6215 00001B62 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6216 00001B66 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6217                                  setret:					
  6218 00001B68 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6219 00001B69 E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6220                                  
  6221                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6222                                  
  6223                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6224                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6225                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6226                                  ;
  6227                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6228                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6229                                  ;  without change.
  6230                                  ;
  6231                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6232                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6233                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6234                                  
  6235                                  set2:		
  6236                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6237                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6238 00001B6C 8816[1F15]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6239                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6240                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6241 00001B70 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6242 00001B74 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6243                                  
  6244                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6245                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6246                                  
  6247 00001B78 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6248 00001B7B 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6249 00001B7E 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6250 00001B82 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6251 00001B86 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6252 00001B88 800E[1C15]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6253                                  okdrive:
  6254 00001B8D 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6255 00001B91 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6256                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6257 00001B94 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6258 00001B98 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6259 00001B9B 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6260 00001B9F 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6261 00001BA3 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6262 00001BA6 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6263                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6264 00001BA9 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6265 00001BAC 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6266 00001BAE 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6267 00001BB1 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6268                                  okdrive_1:
  6269 00001BB3 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6270 00001BB6 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6271 00001BB9 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6272                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6273 00001BBB 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6274 00001BBE 50                      		push	ax
  6275 00001BBF 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6276 00001BC1 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6277 00001BC3 F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6278                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6279                                  
  6280                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6281                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6282                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6283 00001BC5 A3[D71A]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6284 00001BC8 58                      		pop	ax
  6285 00001BC9 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6286 00001BCB 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6287 00001BCD FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6288 00001BCF 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6289 00001BD1 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6290 00001BD4 50                      		push	ax
  6291 00001BD5 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6292                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6293 00001BD7 A1[D71A]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  6294 00001BDA F7F3                    		div	bx
  6295                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6296 00001BDC A3[D71A]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  6297 00001BDF 58                      		pop	ax
  6298 00001BE0 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6299                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6300 00001BE2 833E[D71A]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6301                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6302 00001BE7 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6303 00001BE9 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6304 00001BEC 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6305                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6306                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6307                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6308                                  okdrive_2:
  6309                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6310                                  ; dl is head.
  6311                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6312                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6313                                  
  6314                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6315                                  
  6316 00001BEE 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6317                                  					; check for mini disk
  6318 00001BF2 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6319 00001BF4 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6320                                  					; set the physical track number
  6321                                  oknotmini:
  6322                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6323                                  				
  6324 00001BF7 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  6325 00001BF9 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6326 00001BFB 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  6327 00001BFE 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  6328 00001C00 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch is cylinder (low 8 bits)
  6329                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6330 00001C02 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is head
  6331                                  		
  6332                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6333 00001C04 8A16[1F15]              		mov	dl, [rom_drv_num]
  6334                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6335                                  
  6336                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6337                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6338                                  ; dh is head
  6339                                  ; dl is drive
  6340                                  
  6341                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6342                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6343                                  
  6344                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6345                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6346                                  
  6347 00001C08 0E                      		push	cs
  6348 00001C09 07                      		pop	es
  6349 00001C0A BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6350                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6351                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6352 00001C0D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6353 00001C10 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6354                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6355                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6356                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6357                                  
  6358                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6359                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6360                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6361                                  
  6362                                  		; 11/08/2023
  6363                                  		;mov	bx, disksector	; BIOSDATA:014Eh ; MSDOS 6.21 ; 11/08/2023
  6364                                  					; BIOSDATA:0152h ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
  6365 00001C12 53                      		push	bx
  6366 00001C13 50                      		push	ax
  6367                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6368                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment ('disksector:' is in BIOSDATA) 
  6369 00001C14 803FE9                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0E9h
  6370                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6371 00001C17 740B                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6372 00001C19 803FEB                  		cmp	byte [bx], 0EBh
  6373                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6374 00001C1C 7525                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6375 00001C1E 807F0290                		cmp	byte [bx+2], 90h
  6376                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6377 00001C22 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023
  6378                                  check_1_ok:
  6379                                  		; 11/08/2023
  6380 00001C24 BB[5D01]                		mov	bx, disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB ; disksector+11
  6381                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6382                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record
  6383                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6384 00001C27 8A470A                  		mov	al, [bx+10] ; 12/08/2023 
  6385                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6386 00001C2A 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6387 00001C2C 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6388 00001C2E 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  6389                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6390 00001C30 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  6391 00001C34 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6392                                  
  6393                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6394 00001C36 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  6395                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6396                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  6397                                  					; a power of 2
  6398                                  					;
  6399                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6400                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6401 00001C39 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it zero?
  6402 00001C3B 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6403                                  
  6404                                  ck_power_of_two:
  6405 00001C3D D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift until first bit emerges
  6406 00001C3F 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6407 00001C41 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6408                                  
  6409                                  invalid_boot_record:
  6410 00001C43 58                      		pop	ax
  6411 00001C44 5B                      		pop	bx
  6412 00001C45 E90901                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6413                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6414                                  
  6415                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6416                                  	; 12/08/2023
  6417                                  setret_brdg:
  6418 00001C48 E91DFF                  		jmp	setret
  6419                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6420                                  
  6421                                  unknown3_0_j:
  6422 00001C4B E90701                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6423                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6424                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6425                                  
  6426                                  valid_boot_record:
  6427 00001C4E 58                      		pop	ax
  6428 00001C4F 5B                      		pop	bx
  6429                                  
  6430                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6431                                  
  6432                                  		; 14/08/2023
  6433 00001C50 817F08322E              		cmp	word [bx+8], '2.'
  6434                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6435                                  		;;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  6436 00001C55 7506                    		jnz	short try5
  6437 00001C57 807F0A30                		cmp	byte [bx+10], '0'
  6438                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6439                                  		;;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  6440                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6441                                  		;jnz	short try5
  6442                                  		;jmp	short copybpb
  6443 00001C5B 7425                    		jz	short copybpb
  6444                                  
  6445                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6446                                  ;	; 12/08/2023
  6447                                  ;setret_brdg:
  6448                                  ;		jmp	setret
  6449                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6450                                  ;
  6451                                  ;unknown3_0_j:
  6452                                  ;		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6453                                  ;					; although, content might be bad.
  6454                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6455                                  
  6456                                  try5:
  6457 00001C5D E8AA01                  		call	cover_fdisk_bug
  6458                                  
  6459                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature
  6460

  6899 00001DAC B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  6900 00001DAE 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)

  6902 00001DB2 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6903 00001DB4 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx

  6906 00001DBA 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1

  6918                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)

  6920                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6921                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
