  9400                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9401                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0440h
  9402                                  %if 1 
  9403                                  
  9404                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.
  9405                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
  9406                                  
  9407                                  daycnttoday:	; proc near
  9408                                  
  9409                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
  9410                                  ;
  9411                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
  9412                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
  9413                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
  9414                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
  9415                                  
  9416                                  		; 08/08/2023 (ds:) (near proc)
  9417                                  		; 16/10/2022 (cs:) (far proc)		
  9418 00000424 FF36[8904]              		push	word [daycnt] ; save daycnt
  9419 00000428 813E[8904]891C          		cmp	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  9420                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
  9421 0000042E 7308                    		jnb	short century20
  9422                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 19
  9423                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 80
  9424                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9425 00000430 C706[8D04]1350          		mov	word [base_century], 5013h
  9426 00000436 EB0C                    		jmp	short years
  9427                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9428                                  		
  9429                                  century20:				
  9430                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 20
  9431                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 0
  9432                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9433 00000438 C706[8D04]1400          		mov	word [base_century], 20
  9434 0000043E 812E[8904]891C          		sub	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
  9435                                  					; adjust daycnt
  9436                                  years:					
  9437 00000444 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9438 00000446 A1[8904]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  9439 00000449 BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
  9440                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
  9441 0000044C F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
  9442 0000044E 8916[8904]              		mov	[daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
  9443 00000452 B304                    		mov	bl, 4
  9444 00000454 F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
  9445 00000456 0006[8E04]              		add	[base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
  9446 0000045A FF06[8904]              		inc	word [daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
  9447                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9448 0000045E BB6E01                  		mov	bx, 366
  9449 00000461 B90300                  		mov	cx, 3
  9450                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 366 ; daycnt=remainder of leap year
  9451 00000464 391E[8904]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 366
  9452 00000468 7619                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
  9453 0000046A FE06[8E04]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
  9454                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 366 ; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
  9455 0000046E 291E[8904]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 366 ; 08/08/2023
  9456                                  		;mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
  9457                                  regularyear:	
  9458                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9459 00000472 4B                      		dec	bx ; 365			
  9460                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 365 ; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365; i++)
  9461 00000473 391E[8904]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
  9462 00000477 760F                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
  9463 00000479 FE06[8E04]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; { daycnt -=	365
  9464                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 365 ; }
  9465 0000047D 291E[8904]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023 
  9466 00000481 E2EF                    		loop	regularyear	; }
  9467                                  					;
  9468                                  					; should never fall through loop
  9469                                  leapyear:	
  9470 00000483 C606[9004]1D            		mov	byte [february], 29 ; 08/08/2023			
  9471                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
  9472                                  					; change month table.
  9473                                  yeardone:				
  9474 00000488 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  9475 0000048A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9476 0000048C A1[8904]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
  9477                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  9478 0000048F BE[8F04]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
  9479                                  		;mov	cx, 12
  9480                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9481 00000492 B10C                    		mov	cl, 12
  9482                                  months:					
  9483 00000494 FEC3                    		inc	bl
  9484                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9485 00000496 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
  9486 00000498 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  9487                                  					; dh=0
  9488 0000049A 7605                    		jbe	short month_done
  9489 0000049C 46                      		inc	si		; next month
  9490 0000049D 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
  9491 0000049F E2F3                    		loop	months		;
  9492                                  					; should never fall through loop
  9493                                  month_done:	
  9494 000004A1 C606[9004]1C            		mov	byte [february], 28 ; 08/08/2023
  9495                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
  9496                                  					; restore month table value
  9497 000004A6 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
  9498 000004A8 8A36[8E04]              		mov	dh, [base_year]
  9499 000004AC 8A0E[8D04]              		mov	cl, [base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  9500 000004B0 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  9501                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  9502 000004B3 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
  9503 000004B5 E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  9504 000004B8 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
  9505 000004BA E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  9506 000004BD 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
  9507 000004BF E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  9508 000004C2 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
  9509 000004C4 8F06[8904]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
  9510 000004C8 C3                      		retn
  9511                                  
  9512                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9513                                  
  9514                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
  9515                                  
  9516                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  9517                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  9518                                  		
  9519 000004C9 D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
  9520 000004CB D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
  9521                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
  9522 000004CD C3                      		retn
  9523                                  %endif
  9524                                  
  9525                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9526                                  
  9527                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9528                                  
  9529                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9530                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9531                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9532                                  ;
  9533                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9534                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9535                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9536                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9537                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9538                                  ;
  9539                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9540                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9541                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9542                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9543                                  
  9544                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9545 000004CE E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9546 000004D1 8B36[8904]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9547                                  
  9548                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9549                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9550                                  ;
  9551                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9552                                  ;	       ----------------
  9553                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9554                                  ;
  9555                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9556                                  ;
  9557                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9558                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9559                                  ;		1,193,180
  9560                                  ;
  9561                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9562                                  ;
  9563                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9564                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9565                                  ;		59,659
  9566                                  ;
  9567                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9568                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9569                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9570                                  ;
  9571                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9572                                  ; multiply by 5
  9573                                  
  9574 000004D5 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9575 000004D7 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9576                                  					; multiply by 5
  9577 000004D9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9578 000004DB D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9579 000004DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9580 000004DF D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9581 000004E1 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9582 000004E3 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9583 000004E5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9584                                  
  9585                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9586                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9587                                  
  9588 000004E6 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9589 000004E9 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9590                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9591                                  
  9592                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9593                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9594 000004EB 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9595 000004EC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9596 000004EE F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9597                                  
  9598                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9599                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9600                                  
  9601 000004F0 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9602 000004F2 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9603                                  
  9604                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9605                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9606                                  
  9607 000004F5 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9608 000004F7 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9609 000004FA 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9610 000004FC 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9611                                  noadj:					
  9612 000004FF F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9613 00000500 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9614                                  
  9615                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9616                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9617                                  
  9618 00000502 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9619 00000504 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9620 00000506 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9621 00000508 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9622 0000050B F7F1                    		div	cx
  9623 0000050D 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9624 0000050F F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9625 00000511 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9626                                  
  9627                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9628                                  
  9629                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9630                                  		;push	ax
  9631                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9632 00000513 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9633 00000514 AB                      		stosw
  9634                                  		;pop	ax
  9635 00000515 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9636 00000516 AB                      		stosw
  9637 00000517 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9638 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9639 0000051A F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9640                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9641                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9642                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9643                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9644 0000051B C3                      		retn
  9645                                  
  9646                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9647                                  
  9648                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9649                                  
  9650                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9651                                  ;
  9652                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9653                                  ;
  9654                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9655                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9656                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9657                                  ;
  9658                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9659                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9660                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9661                                  ;			else
  9662                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9663                                  ;		}
  9664                                  ;
  9665                                  ; USES : AX
  9666                                  ;
  9667                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9668                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9669                                  ;
  9670                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9671                                  
  9672                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9673                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9674 0000051C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9675 0000051E CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9676                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9677                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9678                                  					; midnight
  9679                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9680 00000520 803E[8B04]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9681 00000525 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9682 00000527 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9683                                  					; and not flag
  9684 00000529 0106[8904]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9685 0000052D C3                      		retn
  9686                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9687                                  
  9688                                  inc_case:				
  9689 0000052E 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9690 00000530 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9691 00000532 FF06[8904]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9692                                  no_rollover:				
  9693 00000536 C3                      		retn
  9694

  9738                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9739                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9740                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9741                                  
  9742                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9743                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9744                                  
  9745                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9746                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9747                                  
  9748                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9749                                  
  9750                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9751                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9752                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9753                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9754                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9755                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9756                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9757                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9758                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9759                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9760                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9761                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9762                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9763                                  
  9764                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9765                                  
  9766                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9767                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9768                                  ;
  9769                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9770                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9771                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9772                                  ;   else
  9773                                  ;	set slow = value
  9774                                  ;   ...
  9775                                  ;*********************************************
  9776                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9777                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9778                                  ;*	 use slow
  9779                                  ;*   else
  9780                                  ;*	 use fast
  9781                                  ;*********************************************
  9782                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9783                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9784                                  ;	use slow
  9785                                  ;   else
  9786                                  ;	use fast
  9787                                  ;   ...
  9788                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9789                                  ;
  9790                                  ;
  9791                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9792                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9793                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9794                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9795                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9796                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9797                                  
  9798                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9799                                  
  9800                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9801                                  
  9802                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9803

  9805                                  ;	command jump table
  9806                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9807                                  
  9808 0000055A 00                      		db 0
  9809                                  ; 11/12/2022

  9811                                  
  9812                                  dsktbl:		db 26			; 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  9813                                  					; ((dtbl_siz-1)/2) ; this is the size of the table ; 26
  9814                                  		dw 1742h		; dsk_init
  9815                                  		dw 4EBh			; media_chk

  9817                                  		dw 0D5h			; bc_cmderr
  9818                                  		dw 857h			; dsk_read
  9819                                  		dw 83Dh			; x_bus_exit
  9820                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9821                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9822                                  		dw 849h			; dsk_writ
  9823                                  		dw 841h			; dsk_writv
  9824                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9825                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9828                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close

  9877                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9878                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9879                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9880                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9881                                  ;
  9882                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.

  9890 00000598 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv

  9892 0000059D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh

  9903                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9904                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9905                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9906                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed

  9938

  9991                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9992                                  
  9993                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9994                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9995                                  ; drive.
  9996                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9997                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9998                                  ; returns in si:
  9999                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10000                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10001                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10002                                  ;
 10003                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10004                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10005                                  
 10006                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10007                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10008 00000616 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10009 00000619 E800FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10010 0000061C 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10011                                  					; get stored time
 10012 00000620 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10013 00000622 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10014 00000626 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10015                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10016                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 10017                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 10018 00000628 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10019 0000062A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10020 0000062C 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10021                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10022                                  		;inc	al
 10023                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 10024                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 10025                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10026                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10027                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 10028                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10029                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10030                                  		;dec	al
 10031                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10032                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10033 0000062E 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 10034 00000633 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 10035 00000635 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10036 00000639 C3                      		retn
 10037                                  
 10038                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10039                                  
 10040                                  timepassed:
 10041 0000063A 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 10042                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 10043 0000063D 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10044                                  
 10045                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
 10046                                  timecheck_unk:				
 10047 0000063F 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
 10048                                  timecheck_ret:

 10050                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
 10051 00000640 C3                      		retn

 10128                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10129                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10130                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10131                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10132                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10133                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10134                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10135                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
 10136                                  ;
 10137                                  ;	trashes si, cx
 10138                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10139                                  
 10140                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 10141                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 10142                                  
 10143                                  ; 11/09/2023
 10144                                  ; 14/08/2023
 10145                                  ;BDS.fatsiz equ 1Fh

 10147                                  clear_ids:
 10148                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
 10149 0000068A 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
 10150                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
 10151                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
 10152 0000068E 57                      		push	di
 10153 0000068F 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx		; no serial number
 10154 00000691 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10155 00000695 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10156                                  
 10157                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
 10158                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
 10159                                  		; merging them... jgl
 10160                                  
 10161                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10162                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10163 00000699 B10B                    		mov	cl, 11 ; cx = 11		
 10164                                  
 10165                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
 10166 0000069B BE[CB1A]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
 10167 0000069E 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10168 000006A1 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10169                                  		
 10170                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10171                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10172                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10173                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10174                                  
 10175                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10176                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10177                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10178                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10179                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10180                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10181                                  			;
 10182                                  			; Correct Code:
 10183                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10184                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10185                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10186                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10187                                  			;
 10188                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10189                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10190                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10191                                  			;
 10192                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10193                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10194                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10195                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10196                                  
 10197 000006A3 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10198                                  		
 10199                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
 10200 000006A5 BE[3F05]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022
 10201 000006A8 7503                    		jnz	short ci_bigfat
 10202                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_12_id ; "FAT12	"
 10203 000006AA BE[3705]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
 10204                                  ci_bigfat:				
 10205                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10206                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10207 000006AD B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8 
 10208 000006AF 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10209                                  					; filesys_id field
 10210 000006B2 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10211 000006B4 5F                      		pop	di		; restore bds pointer

 10217                                  
 10218                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10219                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10220                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10221                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10222                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10223                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10224                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10225                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10226                                  ;
 10227                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10228                                  ;
 10229                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10230                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10231                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10232                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10233                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10234                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10235                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10236                                  ;
 10237                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10238                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10239                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10240                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10241                                  
 10242                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 10243                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
 10244 000006B6 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
 10245 000006BB 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1

 10407                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10408                                  
 10409                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10410                                  
 10411                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10412                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10413                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10414                                  ;
 10415                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10416                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10417                                  
 10418                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10419                                  
 10420                                  readbootsec:	
 10421 0000076F B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10422 00000771 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10423 00000774 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10424 00000777 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10425 00000779 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10426                                  
 10427                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10428                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10429                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10430                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10431                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10432                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10433                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10434                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10435                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10436                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10437                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10438                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10439                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10440                                  		; informations
 10441                                  
 10442                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10443                                  
 10444                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10445                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10446                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10447                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10448                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10449                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10450                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10451                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10452                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10453                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10454                                  
 10455                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10456 0000077B A0[5201]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10457 0000077E 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10458 00000780 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10459                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10460 00000782 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10461 00000784 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10462                                  					; no need for nop
 10463 00000786 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10464 00000788 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10465 0000078A 803E[5401]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10466 0000078F 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10467                                  
 10468                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10469                                  ;
 10470                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10471                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10472                                  ;;
 10473                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10474                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10475                                  ;;
 10476                                  ;;check_signature:
 10477                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10478                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10479                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10480                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10481                                  
 10482                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10483                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10484                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10485                                  
 10486                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10487                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10488 00000791 A0[6701]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10489                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10490 00000794 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10491 00000795 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10492 00000797 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10493 00000799 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10494 0000079A 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10495                                  
 10496                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10497                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10498                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10499                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10500                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10501                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10502                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10503                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10504                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10505                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10506                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10507                                  
 10508                                  checksinglesided:
 10509                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10510                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10511                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10512 0000079C 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10513 0000079E 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10514 000007A0 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10515 000007A2 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10516 000007A4 813E[5A01]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10517 000007AA 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10518 000007AC 803E[5C01]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10519 000007B1 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10520                                  
 10521                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10522                                  
 10523                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10524 000007B3 C606[5F01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10525                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10526 000007B8 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10527                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10528                                  
 10529                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10530 000007BA 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10531                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10532                                  movbpb_ret:
 10533                                  gooddsk:				
 10534 000007BB F8                      		clc
 10535                                  err_ret:
 10536 000007BC C3                      		retn

 10538                                  
 10539                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10540                                  ;err_ret:				
 10541                                  		;retn

 10543                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10544                                  
 10545                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10546                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10547                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10548                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10549                                  ;
 10550                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10551                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10552                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10553                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10554                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10555                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10556                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10557                                  
 10558                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10559                                  
 10560                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10561                                  movbpb:	
 10562 000007BD 8A36[5F01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10563                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10564                                  					; sectors per unit
 10565 000007C1 8A3E[6301]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10566                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10567                                  					; number of directory entries
 10568 000007C5 8B0E[6501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10569                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10570                                  					; size of drive
 10571 000007C9 8A26[6701]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10572                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10573                                  					; media	descriptor
 10574 000007CD A0[6801]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10575                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10576                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10577 000007D0 8A1E[6A01]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10578                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10579                                  					; sectors per track
 10580 000007D4 8A16[6C01]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10581                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10582                                  					; number of heads
 10583 000007D8 803E[9B04]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10584 000007DD 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10585 000007DF E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10586 000007E2 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10587 000007E4 C606[9B04]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10588                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10589 000007E9 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10590 000007EE 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10591 000007F0 E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10592                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10593                                  		; cf = 0
 10594                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10595                                  		;clc
 10596 000007F3 C3                      		retn
 10597                                  
 10598                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10599                                  
 10600                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10601                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10602                                  ;by es:di.
 10603                                  
 10604                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10605                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10606                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10607                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10608                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10609                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10610                                  
 10611                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10612                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10613 000007F4 803E[7801]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10614                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10615                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10616 000007F9 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10617 000007FB 51                      		push	cx
 10618 000007FC 8B0E[7901]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10619                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10620 00000800 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10621 00000804 8B0E[7B01]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10622                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10623 00000808 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10624 0000080C 57                      		push	di
 10625 0000080D 56                      		push	si
 10626 0000080E B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10627 00000811 BE[7D01]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10628                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10629                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10630 00000814 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10631 00000817 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10632                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10633                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10634 00000819 B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10635 0000081B BE[8801]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10636                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10637 0000081E 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10638 00000821 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10639 00000823 5E                      		pop	si
 10640 00000824 5F                      		pop	di
 10641 00000825 59                      		pop	cx

 10653                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10654                                  
 10655                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10656                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10657                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10658                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10659                                  ; output:
 10660                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10661                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10662                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10663                                  
 10664                                  readfat:	
 10665                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10666                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10667 00000829 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10668 0000082B B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10669                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10670 0000082E E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10671 00000831 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10672 00000833 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10673                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10674 00000835 C3                      		retn
 10675                                  
 10676                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10677                                  
 10678                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10679                                  
 10680                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10681                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10682                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10683                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10684                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10685                                  ;		dh has head
 10686                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10687                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10688                                  ;
 10689                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10690                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10691                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10692                                  ;
 10693                                  ;		carry set
 10694                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10695                                  ;
 10696                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10697                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10698                                  
 10699                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10700                                  
 10701                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10702                                  read_sector:	
 10703 00000836 55                      		push	bp
 10704 00000837 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10705 0000083A 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10706 0000083E BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10707                                  rd_ret:					
 10708 00000841 06                      		push	es
 10709 00000842 1E                      		push	ds
 10710 00000843 07                      		pop	es
 10711 00000844 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10712 00000847 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10713                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10714                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10715                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10716 00000849 07                      		pop	es
 10717 0000084A 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10718                                  rd_rty:					
 10719 0000084C E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10720 0000084F 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10721 00000851 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10722                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10723                                  					; fnon_removable
 10724 00000856 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10725 00000858 803E[A905]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10726 0000085D 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10727 0000085F 50                      		push	ax
 10728 00000860 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10729 00000861 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10730                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10731                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10732                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10733                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10734 00000865 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10735 00000867 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10736                                  		; 
 10737 0000086A 1F                      		pop	ds
 10738 0000086B A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10739 0000086E 58                      		pop	ax
 10740                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10741 0000086F 06                      		push	es
 10742 00000870 1E                      		push	ds
 10743 00000871 07                      		pop	es
 10744 00000872 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10745 00000875 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10746                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10747                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10748                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10749 00000877 07                      		pop	es
 10750 00000878 9C                      		pushf
 10751 00000879 803E[A905]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10752 0000087E 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10753 00000880 50                      		push	ax
 10754 00000881 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10755 00000884 1E                      		push	ds
 10756 00000885 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10757 00000889 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10758 0000088C 1F                      		pop	ds
 10759 0000088D 58                      		pop	ax
 10760                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10761 0000088E 9D                      		popf
 10762 0000088F 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10763 00000891 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10764                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10765                                  
 10766                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10767 00000893 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10768                                  					; return error
 10769 00000895 F9                      		stc
 10770                                  
 10771                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10772                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10773                                  
 10774                                  okret2:					
 10775 00000896 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10776 0000089A 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10777 0000089E 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10778                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10779                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10780 000008A2 9C                      		pushf
 10781 000008A3 E8FD03                  		call	set_tim
 10782 000008A6 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10783 000008A7 5D                      		pop	bp
 10784 000008A8 C3                      		retn

 10790                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah

 10809 000008C9 26FF4D20                		dec	word [es:di+20h]
 10810                                  exitjx:					
 10811                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10812                                  		; cf = 0
 10813                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10814                                  				; (19/07/2019 -	Erdogan	Tan - MSDOS 6.0	IO.SYS - retrodos4.s)
 10815 000008CD C3                      		retn

 10874                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10875                                  
 10876                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10877                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10878                                  
 10879                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10880                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10881                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10882                                  
 10883                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10884                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10885                                  ;
 10886                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10887                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10888                                  
 10889                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10890                                  checksingle:		
 10891 000008F8 50                      		push	ax
 10892 000008F9 53                      		push	bx
 10893 000008FA 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10894                                  
 10895                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10896                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10897                                  
 10898 000008FE F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10899 00000901 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10900 00000903 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10901                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10902 00000906 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10903                                  
 10904                                  
 10905                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10906                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10907                                  
 10908 00000908 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10909                                  					; get physical drive number
 10910 0000090C 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10911 0000090D 57                      		push	di
 10912 0000090E C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10913                                  scan_list:				
 10914 00000912 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10915 00000916 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10916 00000918 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10917 0000091A 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10918 0000091E 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10919 00000920 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10920 00000924 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10921 00000925 07                      		pop	es
 10922 00000926 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10923                                  
 10924                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10925                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10926                                  ; in this case.
 10927 0000092A 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10928 0000092F 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10929                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10930 00000931 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10931 00000936 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10932 00000938 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10933                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10934                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10935 0000093C 06                      		push	es
 10936 0000093D 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10937 00000941 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10938                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10939                                  					; set up sdsb
 10940 00000945 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10941 00000946 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10942                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10943                                  
 10944                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10945                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10946                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10947                                  
 10948                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10949 00000948 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10950 0000094D 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10951 0000094F 50                      		push	ax
 10952 00000950 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10953 00000954 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10954 00000956 06                      		push	es
 10955 00000957 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10956 0000095B 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10957                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10958                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10959 00000960 07                      		pop	es
 10960 00000961 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10961 00000963 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10962 00000964 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10963                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10964 00000966 E8690E                  		call	swpdsk
 10965 00000969 EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10966                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10967                                  
 10968                                  scan_skip:	
 10969 0000096B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10970                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10971                                  					; go to	next bds
 10972 0000096E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10973 00000971 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10974 00000973 F9                      		stc
 10975 00000974 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10976 00000975 07                      		pop	es
