 13845                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13846                                  
 13847                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13848                                  ;
 13849                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13850                                  ;
 13851                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13852                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13853                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13854                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13855                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13856                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13857                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13858                                  ;
 13859                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13860                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13861                                  ;
 13862                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13863                                  
 13864                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13865                                  HMAPtr:
 13866 0000145E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13867                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13868 00001463 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13869                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13870 00001467 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13871 0000146A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13872 0000146C 803E[DD07]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13873                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13874 00001471 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13875 00001473 FF1E[D907]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13876                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13877 00001477 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13878                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13879                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13880 0000147B C3                      		retn
 13881                                  
 13882                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13883                                  
 13884                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13885                                  
 13886                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13887                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13888                                  
 13889                                  move_sector:
 13890                                  
 13891                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13892                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13893                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13894                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13895                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13896                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13897                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13898                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13899                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13900                                  ;
 13901                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13902                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13903                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13904                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13905                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13906                                  
 13907 0000147C FC                      		cld
 13908 0000147D 51                      		push	cx
 13909 0000147E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13910 00001481 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13911 00001485 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13912 00001487 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13913 0000148B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13914 0000148D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13915 0000148F 59                      		pop	cx
 13916 00001490 C3                      		retn
 13917                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13918                                  
 13919                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13920 00001491 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13921 00001493 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13922 00001495 59                      		pop	cx
 13923 00001496 C3                      		retn
 13924                                  
 13925                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13926                                  
 13927                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13928                                  
 13929                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13930                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13931                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13932                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13933                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13934                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13935                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13936                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13937                                  ;
 13938                                  ; input conditions:
 13939                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13940                                  ;
 13941                                  ; output:
 13942                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13943                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13944                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13945                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13946                                  
 13947                                  check_wrap:	
 13948 00001497 50                      		push	ax
 13949 00001498 53                      		push	bx
 13950 00001499 06                      		push	es
 13951 0000149A 57                      		push	di
 13952 0000149B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13953 0000149E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13954                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13955 000014A0 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13956                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13957 000014A5 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13958 000014A7 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13959 000014AB 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13960 000014AD 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13961 000014B0 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13962 000014B2 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13963 000014B4 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13964                                  
 13965                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13966                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13967                                  
 13968 000014B6 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13969 000014B8 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13970                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13971 000014BA 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13972 000014BB 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13973                                  					; if on	boundary
 13974                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13975                                  not_on_bound:
 13976 000014BD 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13977 000014C0 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13978 000014C2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13979 000014C4 40                      		inc	ax
 13980 000014C5 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13981 000014C7 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13982                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13983 000014CA 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13984 000014CE 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13985                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13986                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13987 000014D0 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13988 000014D2 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13989 000014D3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13990                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13991 000014D5 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13992                                  
 13993                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13994                                  
 13995 000014D7 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13996 000014D9 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13997 000014DB 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13998                                  
 13999                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14000                                  
 14001 000014DD 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14002 000014DF 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14003 000014E1 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14004                                  no_head_bound:				
 14005 000014E2 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14006 000014E4 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14007 000014E5 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14008 000014E7 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14009 000014E9 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14010 000014EB 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14011 000014EE B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14012 000014F0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14013 000014F2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14014 000014F4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14015 000014F6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14016 000014F8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14017 000014FA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14018 000014FC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14019                                  no_wrap:				
 14020 000014FE F8                      		clc
 14021 000014FF 5F                      		pop	di
 14022 00001500 07                      		pop	es
 14023 00001501 5B                      		pop	bx
 14024 00001502 58                      		pop	ax
 14025 00001503 C3                      		retn
 14026                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14027                                  
 14028                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14029 00001504 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14030 00001506 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14031 00001508 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14032                                  
 14033                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14034                                  
 14035                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14036                                  
 14037                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14038                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14039                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14040                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14041                                  ;
 14042                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14043                                  
 14044                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14045                                  find_bds:	
 14046 0000150A C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14047                                  fbds_1:					
 14048 0000150E 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14049 00001512 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14050 00001514 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14051                                  					; go to next bds
 14052 00001517 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14053 0000151A 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14054 0000151C F9                      		stc
 14055                                  fdbs_2:					
 14056 0000151D C3                      		retn
 14057                                  
 14058                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14059                                  
 14060                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14061                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14062                                  doint:
 14063                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14064 0000151E 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14065                                  					; get physical drive number
 14066                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14067                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14068                                  		
 14069 00001521 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14070 00001523 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14071 00001525 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14072                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14073 00001527 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14074                                  					; get request code
 14075                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14076 0000152A FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14077                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14078 0000152D 9D                      		popf
 14079                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14080                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14081 0000152E 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14082                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14083                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14084 00001533 9C                      		pushf
 14085                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14086 00001534 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14087                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14088                                  dointdone:				
 14089 00001537 C3                      		retn
 14090                                  
 14091                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14092                                  
 14093                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14094                                  
 14095                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14096                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14097                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14098                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14099                                  ;
 14100                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14101                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14102                                  ;
 14103                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14104                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14105                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14106                                  
 14107                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14108                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14109                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14110                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14111                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14112                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14113                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14114                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14115                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14116                                  ;end struc
 14117                                  
 14118                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14119                                  
 14120                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14121                                  ;	ah = function
 14122                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14123                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14124                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14125                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14126                                  ;   output conditions:
 14127                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14128                                  
 14129                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14130                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14131                                  ;
 14132                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14133                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14134                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14135                                  
 14136                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14137                                  
 14138                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14139                                  
 14140 00001538 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14141                                  
 14142                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14143                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14144                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14145                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14146                                  
 14147                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14148                                  
 14149                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14150                                  
 14151                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14152                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14153                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14154                                  
 14155                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14156 0000153C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14157 00001541 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14158 00001543 53                      		push	bx
 14159 00001544 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14160 00001547 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14161 0000154A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14162 0000154B EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14163                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14164                                  
 14165                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14166                                  
 14167                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14168                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14169                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14170                                  
 14171                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14172                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14173 0000154D 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14174 0000154F 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14175 00001551 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14176 00001552 51                      		push	cx
 14177 00001553 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14178 00001555 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14179 00001557 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14180 00001559 8406[A204]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14181 0000155D 59                      		pop	cx
 14182 0000155E 58                      		pop	ax
 14183 0000155F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14184                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14185 00001561 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14186 00001562 06                      		push	es
 14187                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14188 00001563 2EC41E[3815]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14189                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14190                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14191 00001568 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14192 0000156A 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14193 0000156D 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14194                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14195                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14196 00001571 07                      		pop	es
 14197 00001572 5B                      		pop	bx
 14198 00001573 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14199                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14200                                  
 14201                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14202                                  
 14203                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14204                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14205                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14206                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14207                                  
 14208                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14209 00001575 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14210                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14211 0000157A 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14212 0000157C 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14213                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14214 00001581 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14215                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14216 00001583 50                      		push	ax
 14217 00001584 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14218                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14219                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14220 00001586 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14221                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14222                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14223 0000158B 58                      		pop	ax
 14224 0000158C EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14225                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14226                                  
 14227                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14228                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14229                                  
 14230                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14231                                  
 14232                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14233                                  
 14234                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14235                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14236                                  
 14237                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14238 0000158E 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14239                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14240                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14241 0000158F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14242                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14243                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14244                                  
 14245                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14246                                  
 14247 00001594 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14248 00001597 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14249 0000159A 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14250                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14251                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14252 0000159C 803E[A204]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14253 000015A1 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14254                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14255                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14256                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14257 000015A3 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14258                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14259                                  		
 14260 000015A8 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14261                                  		
 14262 000015A9 803E[AF05]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14263                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14264 000015AE 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14265                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14266                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14267 000015B0 9D                      		popf
 14268 000015B1 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14269                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14270 000015B3 1F                      		pop	ds
 14271 000015B4 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14272                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14273                                  
 14274                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14275                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14276                                  ; a changeline error.
 14277                                  
 14278                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14279 000015B7 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14280                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14281 000015B9 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14282 000015BC 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14283 000015BE 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14284 000015C0 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14285 000015C2 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14286 000015C7 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14287                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14288                                  					; never	would
 14289 000015C9 53                      		push	bx
 14290 000015CA BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14291 000015CD E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14292 000015D0 5B                      		pop	bx
 14293                                  int13b:					
 14294 000015D1 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14295 000015D2 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14296                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14297                                  
 14298                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14299                                  
 14300                                  goterr13:				
 14301 000015D4 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14302 000015D7 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14303                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14304 000015D9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14305 000015DC 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14306 000015DE 803E[A905]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14307 000015E3 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14308                                  
 14309 000015E5 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14310                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14311                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14312                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14313 000015EA 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14314                                  
 14315 000015EC 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14316                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14317                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14318 000015EE 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14319                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14320                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14321 000015F3 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14322 000015F6 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14323 000015F8 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14324 000015FA 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14325 000015FC 53                      		push	bx
 14326 000015FD 51                      		push	cx
 14327 000015FE 52                      		push	dx
 14328 000015FF A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14329                                  loop_ecc:				
 14330 00001602 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14331                                  
 14332                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14333                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14334                                  ;
 14335                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14336                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14337                                  ; track.
 14338                                  ;
 14339                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14340                                  ; this request.
 14341                                  ;
 14342                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14343                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14344                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14345                                  ;
 14346 00001605 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14347                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14348                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14349 00001608 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14350                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14351 0000160D 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14352 0000160F 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14353 00001612 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14354 00001614 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14355 00001617 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14356                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14357                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14358                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14359 00001619 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14360                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14361                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14362                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14363                                  ok11_op:				
 14364 0000161B FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14365 0000161F 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14366 00001621 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14367                                  					; add 200h to address
 14368 00001623 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14369 00001625 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14370 00001627 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14371                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14372                                  
 14373                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14374                                  
 14375                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14376 00001629 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14377                                  ok11_exit:				
 14378 0000162A 5A                      		pop	dx
 14379 0000162B 59                      		pop	cx
 14380 0000162C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14381 0000162D EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14382                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14383                                  
 14384                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14385                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14386                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14387                                  
 14388                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14389 0000162F 06                      		push	es
 14390 00001630 53                      		push	bx
 14391 00001631 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14392 00001634 1E                      		push	ds
 14393 00001635 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14394 00001636 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14395                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14396                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14397 00001639 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14398                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14399 0000163E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14400 0000163F 07                      		pop	es
 14401 00001640 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14402 00001642 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14403 00001645 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14404                                  
 14405                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14406                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14407                                  
 14408                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14409 00001647 56                      		push	si
 14410 00001648 57                      		push	di
 14411 00001649 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14412 0000164B BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 14413 0000164E E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14414 00001651 5F                      		pop	di
 14415 00001652 5E                      		pop	si
 14416 00001653 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14417                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14418                                  
 14419                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14420                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14421                                  
 14422                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14423 00001655 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14424 00001658 FB                      		sti
 14425 00001659 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14426 0000165C 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14427                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14428                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14429 0000165E 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14430 00001661 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14431 00001663 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14432 00001666 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14433 00001668 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14434                                  
 14435                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14436                                  
 14437                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14438                                  
 14439 0000166A 52                      		push	dx
 14440 0000166B 51                      		push	cx
 14441 0000166C 53                      		push	bx
 14442 0000166D 50                      		push	ax
 14443 0000166E 55                      		push	bp
 14444 0000166F 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14445 00001671 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14446 00001673 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14447 00001675 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14448 00001677 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14449 00001679 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14450 0000167B 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14451 0000167D 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14452                                  
 14453                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14454                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14455                                  
 14456 00001681 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14457 00001683 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14458                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14459                                  
 14460                                  no_skip_first:				
 14461 00001686 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14462 00001688 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14463 0000168A 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14464                                  
 14465                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14466                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14467                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14468                                  ;
 14469                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14470                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14471                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14472                                  ; in error.
 14473                                  
 14474 0000168C 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14475 0000168E 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14476                                  
 14477                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14478                                  
 14479 00001690 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14480                                  					; set up head number
 14481 00001693 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14482 00001696 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14483                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14484                                  
 14485                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14486 00001699 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14487 0000169B F9                      		stc
 14488 0000169C E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14489                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14490                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14491                                  
 14492                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14493                                  
 14494                                  intverify:				
 14495 0000169F 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14496 000016A0 53                      		push	bx
 14497 000016A1 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14498 000016A2 07                      		pop	es
 14499                                  dosimple:				
 14500 000016A3 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14501                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14502                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14503                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14504 000016A6 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14505                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14506 000016AB 5B                      		pop	bx
 14507 000016AC 07                      		pop	es
 14508 000016AD E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14509                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14510                                  
 14511                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14512                                  
 14513                                  intformat:				
 14514 000016B0 06                      		push	es
 14515 000016B1 53                      		push	bx
 14516 000016B2 56                      		push	si
 14517 000016B3 57                      		push	di
 14518 000016B4 1E                      		push	ds
 14519                                  
 14520                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14521                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14522                                  
 14523 000016B5 06                      		push	es
 14524 000016B6 1E                      		push	ds
 14525 000016B7 07                      		pop	es
 14526 000016B8 1F                      		pop	ds
 14527 000016B9 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14528 000016BB BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector
 14529 000016BE E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14530 000016C1 1F                      		pop	ds
 14531 000016C2 5F                      		pop	di
 14532 000016C3 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14533 000016C4 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14534                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14535                                  
 14536                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14537                                  ; the first block.
 14538                                  ;
 14539                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14540                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14541                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14542                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14543                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14544                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14545                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14546                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14547                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14548                                  
 14549                                  doblock:
 14550                                  
 14551                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14552                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14553                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14554                                  				
 14555 000016C6 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14556                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14557 000016C9 51                      		push	cx
 14558 000016CA 06                      		push	es
 14559 000016CB 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14560                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14561 000016CC E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14562 000016CF 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14563                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14564 000016D3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14565                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14566 000016D8 5F                      		pop	di
 14567 000016D9 07                      		pop	es
 14568 000016DA 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14569 000016DC 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14570 000016DE B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14571 000016E0 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14572                                  doblockflop:				
 14573 000016E2 59                      		pop	cx
 14574                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14575 000016E3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14576 000016E5 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14577 000016E7 50                      		push	ax
 14578 000016E8 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14579 000016EA EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14580                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14581                                  
 14582                                  doblocklast:				
 14583 000016EC 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14584 000016EE 50                      		push	ax
 14585                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14586 000016EF E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14587 000016F2 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14588 000016F4 58                      		pop	ax
 14589 000016F5 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14590                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14591 000016F8 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14592 000016FA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14593 000016FC 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14594 000016FE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14595 00001700 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14596                                  					; then we are done already.
 14597 00001702 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14598                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14599 00001704 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14600 00001707 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14601                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14602                                  
 14603                                  bufferx:				
 14604 00001709 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14605                                  					; set up head number
 14606                                  buffer:					
 14607 0000170C 53                      		push	bx
 14608 0000170D 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14609 00001710 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14610 00001713 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14611                                  					
 14612                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14613                                  
 14614 00001715 06                      		push	es
 14615 00001716 1E                      		push	ds
 14616 00001717 56                      		push	si
 14617 00001718 57                      		push	di
 14618 00001719 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14619 0000171A 06                      		push	es
 14620 0000171B 1F                      		pop	ds
 14621 0000171C 07                      		pop	es
 14622 0000171D BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14623 00001720 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14624 00001721 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14625 00001723 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14626 00001726 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14627                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14628 00001727 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14629 00001728 5E                      		pop	si
 14630 00001729 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14631                                  
 14632                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14633                                  
 14634 0000172A B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14635                                  					; get drive number
 14636 0000172C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14637 0000172F E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14638                                  					;
 14639                                  					; ah is	function
 14640                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14641                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14642                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14643                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14644                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14645 00001732 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14646 00001735 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14647 00001736 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14648 00001738 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14649                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14650                                  
 14651                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14652                                  
 14653                                  doread:					
 14654 0000173A 06                      		push	es
 14655 0000173B 53                      		push	bx
 14656 0000173C 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14657 0000173D 07                      		pop	es
 14658 0000173E BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14659 00001741 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14660 00001743 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14661                                  					; get drive number
 14662 00001746 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14663                                  					; ah = function
 14664                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14665                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14666                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14667 00001749 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14668 0000174C 5B                      		pop	bx
 14669 0000174D 07                      		pop	es
 14670 0000174E 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14671 00001750 56                      		push	si
 14672 00001751 57                      		push	di
 14673 00001752 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14674 00001754 BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 14675 00001757 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14676 0000175A 5F                      		pop	di
 14677 0000175B 5E                      		pop	si
 14678                                  
 14679                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14680                                  
 14681                                  dotail:					
 14682 0000175C 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14683 0000175D 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14684 00001760 41                      		inc	cx
 14685 00001761 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14686 00001764 F8                      		clc
 14687 00001765 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14688 00001767 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14689                                  
 14690                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14691                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14692                                  
 14693 00001769 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14694 0000176C E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14695 0000176F E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14696                                  
 14697                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14698                                  
 14699                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14700                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14701                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14702                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14703                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14704                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14705                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14706                                  
 14707                                  bad13:					
 14708 00001772 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14709 00001774 5D                      		pop	bp
 14710 00001775 5B                      		pop	bx
 14711 00001776 5B                      		pop	bx
 14712 00001777 59                      		pop	cx
 14713 00001778 5A                      		pop	dx
 14714 00001779 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14715 0000177B E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14716                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14717                                  
 14718                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14719 0000177E E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14720                                  
 14721                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14722                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14723                                  		;db 	0
 14724                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14725                                  
 14726                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14727

 14736                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14737 00001781 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14738 00001785 BF[3C05]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14739 00001788 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di

 14743                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14744                                  
 14745                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14746                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14747                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14748                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14749                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14750                                  
 14751                                  install_bds:
 14752 0000178D 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14753 0000178E BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14754                                  
 14755                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14756                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14757                                  loop_next_bds:
 14758 00001791 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14759                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14760 00001793 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14761 00001797 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14762                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14763 0000179A 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14764 0000179C B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14765 0000179E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14766                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14767 000017A2 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14768 000017A5 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14769                                  					; we don't own it
 14770 000017AA 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14771                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14772 000017AD 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14773 000017B0 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14774                                  next_bds:
 14775                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14776 000017B4 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14777 000017B7 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14778                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14779                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14780 000017B9 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14781 000017BB 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14782                                  					; install bds
 14783 000017BE 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14784 000017C0 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14785                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14786                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14787 000017C3 1F                      		pop	ds
 14788                                  
 14789                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)

 14792                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14793                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14794                                  
 14795                                  		; 01/06/2019

 14797 000017C4 268A4550                		mov	al, [es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]

 14799 000017CC 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14800 000017CE A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot], al
 14801                                  _eot_ok:
 14802 000017D1 C3                      		retn

 14837                                  					; get the drive	letter

 14843 000017E6 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14844 000017E9 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14845 000017EB B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14846                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk

 14850 000017F1 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it

 14853                                  
 14854 000017F3 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'

 14856 000017F6 2E8816[3018]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl

 14861 000017FB BE[1418]                		mov	si, SNGMSG

 14867                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
