 20409                                  
 20410                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20411                                  ;
 20412                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20413                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20414                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20415                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20416                                  ;
 20417                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20418                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20419                                  ;
 20420                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20421                                  
 20422                                  StartVDHead:
 20423                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20424                                  
 20425 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20426 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20427 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20428 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20429 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20430                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20431 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20432                                  VDiskSig1:
 20433 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20434                                  
 20435                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20436                                  
 20437 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20438                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20439 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20440 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20441 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20442                                  VDInt19:
 20443 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20444                                  OldVDInt19:
 20445 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20446                                  
 20447                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20448                                  
 20449                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20450 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20451                                  VDiskSig2:
 20452 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20453                                  
 20454                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20455                                  
 20456 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20457 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20458 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20459 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20460 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20461 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20462 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20463 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20464 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20465 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20466 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20467 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20468 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20469                                  
 20470                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 20471                                  
 20472                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20473                                  ;
 20474                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20475                                  ;
 20476                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20477                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20478                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20479                                  ;
 20480                                  ; Inputs : None
 20481                                  ;
 20482                                  ; Outputs : None
 20483                                  ;
 20484                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20485                                  ;
 20486                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20487                                  
 20488                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20489                                  
 20490                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20491 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20492 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20493                                  
 20494                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20495                                  
 20496                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20497 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20498                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20499 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20500 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20501                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20502 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20503                                  
 20504                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20505                                  
 20506 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20507                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20508                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20509 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20510 00000B3B CD21                    	int	21h
 20511                                  
 20512                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20513                                  
 20514 00000B3D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20515 00000B3E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20516                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20517 00000B40 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20518                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20519 00000B47 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20520 00000B4E 40                      	inc	ax
 20521 00000B4F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20522                                  
 20523                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20524                                  
 20525 00000B51 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20526                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20527 00000B52 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20528 00000B58 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20529                                  
 20530                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20531                                  
 20532                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20533 00000B5B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20534 00000B5E BE[D00A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20535 00000B61 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20536 00000B63 0E                      	push	cs
 20537 00000B64 1F                      	pop	ds
 20538 00000B65 FC                      	cld
 20539 00000B66 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20540 00000B68 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20541                                  
 20542                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20543                                  
 20544                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20545 00000B69 57                      	push	di
 20546 00000B6A 06                      	push	es
 20547                                  
 20548                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20549                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20550                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20551 00000B6B 49                      	dec	cx
 20552                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20553 00000B6C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20554                                  
 20555 00000B6E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20556                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20557 00000B71 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20558 00000B74 BE[040B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20559 00000B77 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20560                                  
 20561 00000B79 5F                      	pop	di
 20562 00000B7A 07                      	pop	es
 20563                                  
 20564 00000B7B C3                      	retn

 20566                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20567                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20568                                  ;
 20569                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 20570                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 20571                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 20572                                  ;
 20573                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20574                                  
 20575                                  struc desc
 20576 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 20577 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 20578 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address

 20580 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;

 20590 00000B84 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0

 20595 00000B92 0000                    		dw	0

 20597 00000B96 0000                    		dw	0

 20599 00000B99 93                      		db	93h

 20601

 20605 00000BA4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0

 20607 00000BAC 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)

 20610                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20611                                  
 20612                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20613                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20614                                  
 20615                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20616                                  
 20617                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20618                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20619                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20620                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20621                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20622                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20623                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20624                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20625                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20626                                  ;								     ;I070
 20627                                  ;	in      al,64h         		; Test for passwd servr mode ;I070
 20628                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070
 20629                                  ;	jnz     short ClrVDISKok	; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20630                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070
 20631                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                	     ;I070
 20632                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20633                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20634                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20635                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20636                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070
 20637                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh			     ;I070
 20638                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20639                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20640                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20641                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20642                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20643                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20644                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20645                                  
 20646                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20647                                  	; ds = cs
 20648                                  
 20649                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20650                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20651                                  
 20652 00000BCC 06                      	push	es
 20653 00000BCD 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20654 00000BCF 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20655 00000BD1 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20656 00000BD3 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20657 00000BD5 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20658 00000BD7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20659 00000BD9 05[AC0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20660 00000BDC 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20661                                  
 20662                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20663                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20664                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20665                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl

 20674 00000BE9 0E                      	push	cs
 20675 00000BEA 07                      	pop	es

 20679                                  			; CX = number of words to move

 20686                                  ;
 20687                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20688                                  ;
 20689                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20690                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20691                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20692                                  ;		the offset.
 20693                                  ;
 20694                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20695                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20696                                  ;
 20697                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20698                                  
 20699                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 20700                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20701 00000BF4 1E                      	push	ds
 20702 00000BF5 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20703 00000BF8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20704                                  	;
 20705 00000BFA 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20706 00000BFC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20707                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20708 00000BFF A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 20709                                  	;
 20710 00000C02 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20711 00000C04 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20712 00000C07 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20713 00000C0A B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20714 00000C0C D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20715 00000C0E 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20716                                  	;
 20717                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20718                                  	;push	ds
 20719                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20720                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 20721                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20722                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20723                                  	;mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 20724                                  	;mov	ds,ax
 20725 00000C10 893E[D707]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20726                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 20727 00000C14 1F                      	pop	ds
 20728 00000C15 C3                      	retn

 20733                                  ;

 20735                                  ;		& INT 19 vector

 20770                                  ;
 20771                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20772                                  ;
 20773                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20774                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20775                                  ;
 20776                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20777                                  
 20778                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20779                                  CPMHack:
 20780 00000C3D 1E                      	push	ds
 20781 00000C3E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20782 00000C41 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = 0FFFFh
 20783                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20784                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20785 00000C43 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20786 00000C44 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0

 21695                                  
 21696                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21697                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21698                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21699                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21700                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21701                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21702                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21703                                  ;
 21704                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21705                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21706                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21707                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21708                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21709                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21710                                  ;
 21711                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21712                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21713                                  ;
 21714                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21715                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21716                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21717                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21718                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21719                                  ;
 21720                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21721                                  ;
 21722                                  ;			  none.
 21723                                  
 21724                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21725                                  ;
 21726                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21727                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21728                                  
 21729                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21730                                  
 21731 00000FE5 50                      	push	ax

 21745 00000FF5 42                      	inc	dx

 21773 0000101A EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh

 21776 0000101D 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 21777 0000101E 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 21778 0000101F EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f6h,0ffh

 21935                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21936                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21937                                  ;
 21938                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21939                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21940                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21941                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21942                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21943                                  ; program).
 21944                                  
 21945                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21946                                  
 21947                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21948                                  
 21949 000010CD 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21950                                  
 21951                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21952                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21953                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21954                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21955                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21956                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21957                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21958                                  ; carridge return.
 21959                                  
 21960                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21961                                  ;character after =.
 21962

 21967 000010D2 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.

 22097                                  	call    error_line
 22098                                  	stc
 22099                                  sysinitptr_retn:	; (SYSINIT:114Fh)
 22100                                  	retn		
 22101                                  
 22102                                  %endif ; 24/10/2022
 22103                                  
 22104                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22105                                  
 22106                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22107                                  ;
 22108                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22109                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22110                                  ;
 22111                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22112                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22113                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22114                                  
 22115                                  ParaRound:
 22116 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22117 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22118 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22119 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22120 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22121 00001156 C3                      	retn
 22122                                  
 22123                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22124                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22125                                  ;
 22126                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22127                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22128                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22129                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22130                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22131                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22132                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22133                                  ;
 22134                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22135                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22136                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22137                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22138                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22139                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22140                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 22141                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22142                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22143                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22144                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22145                                  ;
 22146                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22147                                  
 22148                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22149                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22150                                  sysinit_base:				
 22151 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22152 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22153 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22154 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22155 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22156 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22157 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22158 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22159                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22160                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22161 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22162 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22163 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22164                                  
 22165                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22166                                  
 22167 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22168 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 22169 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22170                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22171                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22172                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22173 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22174                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22175 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 22176                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22177                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22178                                  
 22179                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22180                                  stall:
 22181                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22182                                  _stall: 
 22183                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22184 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 22185                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22186                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22187 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22188                                  
 22189                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22190 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22191                                  
 22192                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22193                                  
 22194                                  sum_up:
 22195                                  
 22196                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22197                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22198                                  ;
 22199                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22200                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22201                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22202                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22203                                  ;
 22204                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22205                                  
 22206 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 22207                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22208                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22209 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22210                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22211                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22212 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22213 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22214 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22215 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22216                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22217 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22218 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22219                                  sum1:
 22220 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22221 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 22222 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 22223 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22224                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22225                                  sum_sys_code:
 22226                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22227 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22228                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22229                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22230                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22231                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22232                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22233                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22234                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22235 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22236 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22237 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22238                                  sum2:
 22239 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22240 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 22241 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 22242 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22243 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22244 000011B8 C3                      	retn
 22245                                  
 22246                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22247                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22248                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22249                                  
 22250                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22251                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22252 000011B9 0000                    	dw	0
 22253                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22254                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22255 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0	
 22256                                  
 22257                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 22258                                  
 22259                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 22260                                  
 22261                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h
 22262 000011BD 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 22263 000011BF 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 22263 000011C8 6C6F636174696F6E20-

 22269                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22270                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22271                                  ;
 22272                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22273                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22274                                  ;
 22275                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22276                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22277                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22278                                  ;
 22279                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22280                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 22281                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22282                                  
 22283                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22284                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)

 22286                                  set_buffer:
 22287 000011D8 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 22288 000011DA E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 22289 000011DD 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 22290                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 22291                                  	; 17/09/2023
 22292 000011DF FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 22293                                  set_buff_1:
 22294                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22295                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 22296 000011E1 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 22297                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 22298 000011E3 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 22299                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 22300 000011E6 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 22301                                  
 22302 000011EB 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 22303 000011ED 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 22304 000011F2 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 22305                                  
 22306                                  ;	for each buffer
 22307                                  
 22308                                  nxt_buff:
 22309 000011F3 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 22310 000011F6 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 22311 000011F8 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 22312                                  
 22313 000011FA 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22314                                  
 22315 000011FF 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 22316                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22317 00001200 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22318 00001203 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22319                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22320                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22321 00001205 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 22322                                  
 22323 00001209 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 22324 0000120B 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 22325                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 22326 0000120D C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22327 00001211 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 22328                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of scratch buff is 0
 22329 00001215 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 22330                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 22331 0000121A 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 22332 0000121D 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 22333                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 22334                                  	;; 05/09/2023
 22335                                  	;;sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 22336 00001221 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 22337                                  set_buff_2:
 22338 00001224 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 22339                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 22340 00001229 2E800E[BD14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 22341                                  	;call	round
 22342                                  	;retn
 22343                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22344 0000122F E93D30                  	jmp	round
 22345                                  
 22346                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22347                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22348                                  ;
 22349                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22350                                  ;
 22351                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22352                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22353                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22354                                  
 22355                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22356                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22357 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 22358 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 22359 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22360 00001238 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22361                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22362 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22363                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22364                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22365                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22366 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22367 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22368 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22369                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22370 00001247 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22371 00001249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22372 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22373                                  
 22374                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22375                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22376                                  	; zf=1
 22377 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22378                                  	; zf=1
 22379                                  	
 22380                                  	;zf=1
 22381                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22382                                  	;zf=1
 22383 0000124F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22384                                  got_hma:
 22385 00001254 5A                      	pop	dx
 22386 00001255 5B                      	pop	bx
 22387 00001256 C3                      	retn

 22392

 22394                                  ;

 22396                                  ;    ax = di
 22397                                  ;
 22398                                  ;out:
 22399                                  ;    above entries set.
 22400

 22402 00001257 2EFF36[BD02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 22403                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 22404 0000125C 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 22405 00001260 2EA3[BD02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 22406 00001264 2E0306[9D02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; adjust ax
 22407                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 22408 00001269 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 22409                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 22410 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22411                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22412 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22413                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22414 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22415 0000127E C3                      	retn
 22416                                  
 22417                                  ; ======================================================================
 22418                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22419                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22420                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22421                                  
 22422                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22423                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22424                                  ;
 22425                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22426                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22427                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22428                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22429                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22430                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22431                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22432                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22433                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22434                                  ;
 22435                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22436                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22437                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22438                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22439                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22440                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22441                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22442                                  ;	conditions:
 22443                                  ;
 22444                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22445                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22446                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22447                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22448                                  ;
 22449                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22450                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22451                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22452                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22453                                  ;
 22454                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22455                                  ;
 22456                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22457                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22458                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22459                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22460                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22461                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22462                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22463                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22464                                  ;
 22465                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22466                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22467                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22468                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22469                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 22470                                  ;
 22471                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22472                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22473                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22474                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22475                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22476                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22477                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22478                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22479                                  ;
 22480                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22481                                  
 22482                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22483                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22484                                  
 22485                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22486                                  stackinit:
 22487 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 22488 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 22489 00001281 06                      	push	es
 22490 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 22491 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 22492 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 22493 00001285 57                      	push	di
 22494 00001286 56                      	push	si
 22495 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 22496                                  
 22497                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22498                                  
 22499                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22500                                  	; ds = cs
 22501 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22502 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22503                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22504                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22505                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22506 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22507                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22508 00001291 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22509 00001294 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22510                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22511 00001298 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22512                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22513                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22514                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22515 0000129B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22516                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22517 0000129F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22518 000012A1 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22519                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22520                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22521                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22522 000012A4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22523                                  
 22524                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22525                                  
 22526                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22527                                  
 22528                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22529                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22530                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22531 000012A8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22532                                  
 22533                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22534                                  
 22535 000012AD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22536                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22537                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22538                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22539 000012B0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22540 000012B2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22541 000012B4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22542 000012B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22543 000012BA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22544                                  
 22545                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with

 23324                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23325                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23326                                  
 23327                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23328                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23329                                  
 23330                                  new_init_loop:
 23331                                  
 23332                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23333                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23334                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23335                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23336                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23337                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23338                                  
 23339 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23340 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23341 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23342 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23343                                  
 23344 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 23345                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23346                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23347                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23348 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23349 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23350 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23351 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23352 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23353 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23354 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23355                                  
 23356 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23357 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23358 00001497 C3                      	retn
 23359                                  
 23360                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23361                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 23364                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23365                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23366                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23367                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23368                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23369                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23370                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23371                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 23385                                  
 23386 00001498 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]

 23388 000014A2 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23389                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23390                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23391 000014A4 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23392 000014A8 41                      	inc	cx
 23393                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23394 000014A9 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23395

 23397                                  	;pop	cx
 23398                                  	;pop	es
 23399                                  	
 23400 000014AE 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]

 23632                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23633                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23634                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23635                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23636                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23637                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23638                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23639                                  
 23640                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23641                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23642 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23643 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23644 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23645                                  endstruc
 23646                                  
 23647                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23648                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23649                                  ;
 23650                                  ;
 23651                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23652                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23653                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23654                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23655                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23656                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23657                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23658                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23659                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23660                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23661                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23662                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23663                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23664                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23665                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23666                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23667                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23668                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23669                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23670                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23671                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23672                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23673                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23674                                  ;	   :
 23675                                  ;
 23676                                  ;Note:
 23677                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23678                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23679                                  ;
 23680                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23681                                  ;
 23682                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23683                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23684                                  ;
 23685                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23686                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23687                                  ;
 23688                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23689                                  ;
 23690                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23691                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23692                                  ;
 23693                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23694                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23695                                  ;
 23696                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23697                                  ;
 23698                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23699                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23700                                  ;
 23701                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23702                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23703                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23704                                  ;
 23705                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23706                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23707                                  ;
 23708                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23709                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23710                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23711                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23712                                  
 23713                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23714                                  
 23715                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23716                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23717                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23718                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23719                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23720                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23721                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23722                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23723                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23724                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23725                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23726                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23727                                  
 23728                                  ;**** Function flags
 23729                                  
 23730                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23731                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23732                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23733                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23734                                  
 23735                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23736                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23737 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23738 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23739 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23740 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23741 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23742 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23743                                  endstruc
 23744                                  
 23745                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23746                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23747                                  ;
 23748                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23749                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23750                                  ;	     +-
 23751                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23752                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23753                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23754                                  ;	     |	:
 23755                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23756                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23757                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23758                                  ;	     |	:
 23759                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23760                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23761                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23762                                  ;	     +-	:
 23763                                  ;
 23764                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23765                                  ;
 23766                                  ;Note:
 23767                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23768                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23769                                  ;
 23770                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23771                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23772                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23773                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23774                                  
 23775                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23776                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23777                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23778                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23779                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23780                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23781                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23782                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23783                                  
 23784                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23785 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23786 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23787 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23788 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23789 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23790                                  endstruc
 23791                                  
 23792                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23793                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23794                                  ;
 23795                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23796                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23797                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23798                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23799                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23800                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23801                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23802                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23803                                  ;
 23804                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23805                                  ;
 23806                                  ;            +-
 23807                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23808                                  ;	    | or
 23809                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23810                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23811                                  ;	    | or
 23812                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23813                                  ;	    | or
 23814                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23815                                  ;	    | or
 23816                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23817                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23818                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23819                                  ;	    | or
 23820                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23821                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23822                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23823                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23824                                  ;	    +-
 23825                                  ;
 23826                                  ;
 23827                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23828                                  ;      list.
 23829                                  ;
 23830                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23831                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23832                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23833                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23834                                  
 23835                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23836                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23837 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23838 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23839 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23840 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23841                                  endstruc
 23842

 23844                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 23845

 23848                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 23849                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 23850                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 23851                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 23852                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 23853                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 23854                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 23855                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String

 23862

 23864                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 23865                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23866                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23867                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23868                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23869                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23870                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23871                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23872                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23954                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
