 23958                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23959                                  ; SysParse;
 23960                                  ;
 23961                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23962                                  ;
 23963                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23964                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23965                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23966                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23967                                  ;
 23968                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23969                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23970                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23971                                  ;
 23972                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23973                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23974                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23975                                  ;
 23976                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23977                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23978                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23979                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23980                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23981                                  ;
 23982                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23983                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23984                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23985                                  ;
 23986                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23987                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23988                                  ;
 23989                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23990                                  ;
 23991                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23992                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23993                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23994                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23995                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23996                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23997                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23998                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23999                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24000                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24001                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24002                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24003                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24004                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24005                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24006                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24007                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24008                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24009                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24010                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24011                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24012                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24013                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24014                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24015                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24016                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24017                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24018                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24019                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24020                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24021                                  
 24022                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24023                                  
 24024                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24025                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24026                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24027                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24028                                  
 24029                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24030                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24031                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24032                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24033                                  ;
 24034                                  
 24035                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24036                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24037                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24038                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24039                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24040                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24041                                  
 24042                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24043                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24044                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24045                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24046                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24047                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24048                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24049                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24050                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24051                                  
 24052                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24053                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24054                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24055                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24056                                  ;	     segment.

 24655                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24656                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24657                                  ;
 24658                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24659                                  ;
 24660                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24661                                  ;	    AL = type
 24662                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24663                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24664                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24665                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24666                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24667                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24668                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24669                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24670                                  ;
 24671                                  ; Output:   None
 24672                                  ;
 24673                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24674                                  ;
 24675                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24676                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24677                                  
 24678                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24679 0000177B 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24680 0000177C 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 24681                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 24682 00001780 2E893E[C914]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 24683                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 24684                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24685                                  	; 07/09/2023
 24686                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 24687 00001785 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 24688                                  
 24689 00001788 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24690 00001789 2EA1[D814]              	mov	ax,[cs:_$P_Found_SYNONYM] ;AC034; if yes,
 24691 0000178D 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 24692                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 24693 00001791 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24694                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 24695 00001792 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 24696 00001794 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;
 24697                                  
 24698                                  _$P_RLT02:				;AN000;

 24714

 24767                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24768                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 24769                                  ;
 24770                                  ; Function:  Check the match_flags and make the exit code and set the
 24771                                  ;	     result buffer
 24772                                  ;
 24773                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 24774                                  ;		Complex
 24775                                  ;		Date
 24776                                  ;		Time
 24777                                  ;		Drive
 24778                                  ;		Filespec
 24779                                  ;		Quoted String
 24780                                  ;		Simple String
 24781                                  ;
 24782                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24783                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24784                                  ;
 24785                                  ; Output:    None
 24786                                  ;
 24787                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format

 25070                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25071                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25072                                  ;
 25073                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25074                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25075                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25076                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25077                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25078                                  ;
 25079                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25080                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25081                                  ;
 25082                                  ; Output:    None
 25083                                  ;
 25084                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25085                                  ;
 25086                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25087                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25088                                  
 25089                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25090                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25091                                  
 25092                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25093                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25094                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25095 0000192A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25096 0000192B 2E800E[D114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25097 00001931 2E8026[D114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25098                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25099 00001937 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25100 0000193A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25101 0000193C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25102                                  
 25103 0000193E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25104 00001940 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25105                                  
 25106 00001942 2E800E[D114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25107                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25108 00001948 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25109                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25110 00001949 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25111 0000194C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25112 0000194D C3                      	retn
 25113                                  
 25114                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25115                                  
 25116                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25117                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 25118                                  
 25119                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25120                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25121 0000194E 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25122 0000194F 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25123 00001950 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25124 00001951 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25125 00001952 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 25126 00001954 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 25127 00001956 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 25128                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 25129 00001957 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25130 0000195A 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 25131 0000195C 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 25132                                  
 25133 0000195E E8E000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 25134 00001961 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 25135                                  
 25136 00001963 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 25137 00001965 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 25138                                  
 25139                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25140                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 25141                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 25142                                  %if 0
 25143                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 25144                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25145                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25146                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25147                                  
 25148                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 25149                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 25150                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 25151                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25152                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25153                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25154                                  
 25155                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 25156                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25157                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25158                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25159                                  
 25160                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 25161                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 25162                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25163                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25164                                  
 25165                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 25166                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 25167                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25168                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25169                                  
 25170                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 25171                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25172                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 25173                                  %endif

 25374                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25375                                  ;
 25376                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25377                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25378                                  ;
 25379                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25380                                  ;
 25381                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25382                                  ;
 25383                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25384                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25385                                  
 25386                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25387                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25388 00001A2F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25389 00001A30 2EF606[D114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25390 00001A36 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25391                                  
 25392 00001A38 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25393 00001A39 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25394                                  
 25395                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25396 00001A3A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25397 00001A3B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25398                                  
 25399 00001A3D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25400 00001A3E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25401                                  
 25402                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25403 00001A3F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25404 00001A40 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25971                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25972                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 25973                                  ;
 25974                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 25975                                  ;
 25976                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25977                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25978                                  ;
 25979                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 25980                                  ;**********************************************************************
 25981                                  
 25982                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 25983 00001C3B 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25984 00001C3C 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;

 25986 00001C3F 742C                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25987 00001C41 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 25988 00001C43 7428                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25989                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 25990 00001C45 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 25991 00001C47 7424                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25992                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 25993 00001C49 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 25994                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 25995 00001C4E 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 25996 00001C50 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 25997 00001C52 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 25998                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 25999 00001C56 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 26000                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26001 00001C59 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *
 26002 00001C5B 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 26003 00001C5F 740B                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 26004                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26005                                  	;;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 26006                                  	;xor	ch,ch ; *
 26007 00001C61 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; 
 26008                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 26009 00001C64 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26010 00001C65 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 26011 00001C68 7403                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26012 00001C6A E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 26013                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26014                                  	; cx=0
 26015                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 26016                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 26017                                  	; 08/07/2023

 26019                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 26020 00001C6D 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26021 00001C6E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;

 26024                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26025                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26026                                  ;
 26027                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26028                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26029                                  ;	    blanks.
 26030                                  ;
 26031                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26032                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26033                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26034                                  ;
 26035                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26036                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26037                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26038                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26039                                   
 26040                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26041                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26042                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26043                                  
 26044                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26045 00001C70 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26046 00001C71 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26047 00001C72 2EC606[CB14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26048                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26049                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26050 00001C78 2E8026[D114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26051 00001C7E 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26052 00001C80 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26053                                  
 26054 00001C82 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26055 00001C84 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26056                                  
 26057 00001C86 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26058 00001C88 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26059                                  
 26060                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26061                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26062                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26063                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26064                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26065                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26066                                  %if 0
 26067                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26068                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26069                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26070                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26071                                  
 26072                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26073                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26074                                  
 26075                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26076                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26077                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26078                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26079                                  %endif
 26080                                  
 26081                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26082 00001C8A 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26083                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26084 00001C8F 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26085                                  
 26086                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26087 00001C91 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26088                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26089 00001C93 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26090                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26091                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26092                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26093                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26094 00001C97 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26095                                  
 26096 00001C99 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26097                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26098 00001C9C 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26099 00001C9D 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26100 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26101                                  
 26102 00001CA2 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26103                                  
 26104                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26105                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26106                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26107                                  	; cx=0 here
 26108 00001CA4 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26109                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26110                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26111 00001CA5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26112 00001CA6 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;

 26114                                  
 26115                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26116 00001CA8 2EA2[CB14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26117 00001CAC 2EF606[D114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26118 00001CB2 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26119                                  
 26120 00001CB4 2E800E[D114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26121                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26122                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26123 00001CBA 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26124 00001CBC EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26126                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26127                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26128                                  ;
 26129                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26130                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26131                                  ;
 26132                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26133                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26134                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26135                                  ;
 26136                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set) if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26137                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26138                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26139                                  
 26140                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26141                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26142                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26143                                  ;
 26144                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26145                                  
 26146                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26147                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26148                                  
 26149                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26150                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26151                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26152                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26153 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26154                                  
 26155                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26156 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26157 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26158                                  
 26159                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26160 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26161 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26162                                  
 26163 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26164                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26165                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26166 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 26167                                  
 26168                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26169                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26170                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26171                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26172                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26173                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26174                                  
 26175                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26176                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26177 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26178 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26179                                  
 26180 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26181                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26182                                  
 26183                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26184                                  	; cf=0
 26185                                  	;retn
 26186                                  
 26187                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26188                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26189                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26190 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26191                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26192                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26193 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26195                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26196                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26197                                  ;
 26198                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26199                                  ;
 26200                                  ;  Input:
 26201                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26202                                  ;
 26203                                  ;  Output:
 26204                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26205                                  ;
 26206                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26207                                  ;
 26208                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26209                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26210                                  
 26211                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26212 00001CD7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26213 00001CD8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26214 00001CD9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26215                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26216                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26217                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26218 00001CDA 2E8B36[CE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26219 00001CDF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26220 00001CE1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26221 00001CE3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26222 00001CE4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26223 00001CE5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26224 00001CE6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26225 00001CE7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26226 00001CE8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26227 00001CE9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26228                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26229                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26230 00001CEA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26231 00001CEC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26232 00001CEF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26233                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26234 00001CF1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26235 00001CF3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26236 00001CF5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26237 00001CF6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26238 00001CF7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26239 00001CF8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26240 00001CF9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26241 00001CFA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26242 00001CFB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26243 00001CFC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26244                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26245 00001CFE 2E8936[CC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26246 00001D03 2E891E[CE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26247                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26248                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26249                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26250                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26251 00001D08 2EC536[CC14]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26252                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26253 00001D0D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26254 00001D10 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26255 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26256 00001D14 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26257 00001D16 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26258 00001D19 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26259 00001D1B F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26260 00001D1C EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26261                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26262 00001D1E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26263 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26264                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26265 00001D20 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26266                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26267                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26268                                  	; cf=0
 26269                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26270                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26271 00001D22 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26272 00001D23 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26273 00001D24 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 26274 00001D25 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26335 00001D2B 0102[351D][491D]        	dw	201h,buf_pos1,buf_pos2	; min 1, max 2 positionals

 26841                                  
 26842                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26843                                  ;
 26844                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26845                                  ;
 26846                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26847                                  ;
 26848                                  ;   Modification log:
 26849                                  ;
 26850                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26851                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26852                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26853                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26854                                  ;
 26855                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26856                                  ;
 26857                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26858                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26859                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26860                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26861                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26862                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26863                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26864                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26865                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26866                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26867                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26868                                  ;
 26869                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26870                                  
 26871                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26872                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26873                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26874                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26875                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26876                                  
 26877                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26878                                  
 26879                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26880                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26881                                  
 26882                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26883                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26884                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26885                                  
 26886                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26887                                  ;
 26888                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26889                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26890                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 if the user has specified /S on the command-
 26891                                  ;	           line.
 26892                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26893                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26894                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26895                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26896                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26897                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26898                                  ;	          will be set to 1. All others will be set to 0.
 26899                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26900                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26901                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26902                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26903                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26904                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26905                                  ;	           for details).
 26906                                  
 26907 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26908 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26909 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26910 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26911 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26912 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26913 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26914 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26915 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26916                                  
 26917                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26918                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26919                                  
 26920                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26921                                  
 26922                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26923

 26933

 26935 00001F5F 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26936 00001F61 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26937 00001F63 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26938 00001F67 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26939                                  ; 30/12/2022

 26942                                  ;

 26944 00001F6D 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; current UMB used for loading devices (paras)
 26945 00001F6F 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26946 00001F71 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free mem blk in the current UMB (paras)

 26996

 27004 00001FA0 BA[4F45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ; now pointing to file description
 27005 00001FA3 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27006                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		; open file "config.sys"
 27007 00001FA6 F9                      	stc				; in case of int 24h

 27009 00001FA9 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27010

 27020 00001FB4 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 27021 00001FB6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0

 27023                                  	;mov	ax,4202h

 27025 00001FBD CD21                    	int	21h
 27026 00001FBF A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 27027                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27028 00001FC2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27029                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27030                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 27031                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))

 27033                                  					;  size > 64KB)

 27039 00001FC9 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27040                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27041                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27042                                  
 27043 00001FCD A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27044 00001FD0 A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27045 00001FD3 E875F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27046 00001FD6 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27047                                  
 27048                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27049                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27050                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27051                                  ;
 27052                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27053                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27054                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27055                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27056                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27057                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27058                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27059                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27060                                  ;
 27061 00001FD8 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27062 00001FD9 8916[B614]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27063 00001FDD 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27064                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 27067                                  	
 27068                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27069 00001FE2 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27070 00001FE6 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27071                                  	
 27072                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27073                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27074                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27075                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27076                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27077                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27078                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]	
 27079                                  
 27080                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27081                                  	; ds = cs
 27082 00001FEA 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27083                                  
 27084 00001FEE 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27085 00001FF0 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27086                                  
 27087 00001FF2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27088                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27089                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27090 00001FF4 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27091                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27092 00001FF6 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27093 00001FF7 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27094 00001FF9 9C                      	pushf
 27095                                  
 27096                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27097                                  
 27098 00001FFA 50                      	push	ax
 27099 00001FFB 57                      	push	di
 27100 00001FFC 51                      	push	cx
 27101 00001FFD B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27102 00001FFF 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27103 00002001 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27104 00002003 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27105 00002005 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27106                                  
 27107                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27108                                  
 27109 00002007 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27110                                  
 27111                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27112                                  
 27113                                  puteol:
 27114 00002008 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27115 0000200A AA                      	stosb
 27116 0000200B B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27117 0000200D AA                      	stosb
 27118 0000200E 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27119                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27120                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27121                                  
 27122                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27123                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27124 00002010 0E                      	push	cs
 27125 00002011 1F                      	pop	ds
 27126                                  
 27127 00002012 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27128                                  
 27129 00002016 59                      	pop	cx
 27130 00002017 5F                      	pop	di
 27131 00002018 58                      	pop	ax
 27132                                  
 27133                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27134                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27135                                  	;push	cs
 27136                                  	;pop	ds
 27137                                  
 27138 00002019 50                      	push	ax
 27139                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27140 0000201A B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27141 0000201C CD21                    	int	21h
 27142 0000201E 58                      	pop	ax
 27143 0000201F 9D                      	popf
 27144 00002020 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;we've got a problem
 27145 00002022 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax			; if ax <(>) cx
 27146 00002024 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27147                                  conferr:
 27148 00002026 BA[4F45]                	mov	dx,config		;print config error
 27149 00002029 E87924                  	call	badfil
 27150                                  	; 17/09/2023
 27151                                  endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 27152 0000202C C3                      	retn

 27155                                  ;
 27156                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 27157                                  ;
 27158                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands

 27163                                  multi_pass:
 27164 0000202D 0E                      	push	cs
 27165 0000202E 1F                      	pop	ds
 27166                                  
 27167 0000202F 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 27168                                  ;jae_endconv:
 27169 00002034 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 27170                                  
 27171                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27172 00002036 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]
 27173                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27174                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 27175 0000203A 07                      	pop	es			; es = [confbot] (CONFIG.SYS image seg)
 27176                                  
 27177 0000203B 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 27178 0000203F 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 27179 00002043 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 27180 00002045 8936[5A03]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 27181 00002049 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 27182                                  
 27183 0000204D E8DC21                  	call	getchr
 27184 00002050 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 27185                                  
 27186                                  	; 17/09/2023
 27187                                  	; 01/01/2023
 27188                                  ;endconv:
 27189                                  	;retn	
 27190                                  
 27191                                  getcom:
 27192                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27193                                  	; ds = cs
 27194 00002052 E81416                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 27195 00002055 E8D421                  	call	getchr
 27196                                  conflp: 
 27197 00002058 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 27198                                  
 27199 0000205A FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 27200                                  	
 27201                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27202 0000205E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 27203                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27204                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 27205 00002060 8826[BA14]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 27206 00002064 8826[BD14]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 27207                                  
 27208 00002068 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 27209 0000206A 7448                    	je	short blank_line	; then ignore this line.
 27210                                  
 27211                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27212                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 27213                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27214                                  ;%if 0
 27215                                  
 27216                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27217                                  
 27218                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27219                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27220                                  
 27221 0000206C A2[B814]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27222                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27223 0000206F 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27224                                  	
 27225                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27226 00002071 3826[B914]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 27227                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27228 00002075 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27229                                  
 27230 00002077 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27231 00002078 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27232 0000207B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27233 0000207D E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27234 00002080 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27235 00002082 A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27236 00002085 58                              pop     ax
 27237                                  ;
 27238                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27239                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27240                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27241                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27242                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27243                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27244                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27245                                  ;   spot.
 27246                                  ;
 27247                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27248                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27249                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27250                                  ;   retrieved.
 27251                                  ;
 27252 00002086 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27253 0000208B 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27254                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27255 0000208D F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27256 00002092 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27257 00002094 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27258 00002099 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27259                                  final:                                  ;
 27260 0000209B 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27261                                  not_final:                              ;
 27262                                  ;endif
 27263                                  
 27264                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27265                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27266                                  
 27267 0000209E 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27268 000020A0 E88921                  	call	getchr
 27269 000020A3 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27270                                  
 27271 000020A5 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 27272                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 27273                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27274 000020AA 7380                    	jnb	short endconv	
 27275 000020AC E95408                  	jmp	badop
 27276                                  	
 27277                                  coff:	
 27278                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27279                                  	; ds = cs
 27280                                  	;push	cs

 27287 000020B7 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 27288                                  
 27289                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27290                                  ; 11/12/2022
 27291                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 27292                                  ;coff_p:
 27293                                  	;push	cs
 27294                                  	;pop	ds
 27295                                  
 27296                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 27297                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27298                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27299                                  ;install= command.
 27300                                  
 27301                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27302                                  ;install command
 27303                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27304                                  
 27305                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27306                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 27307                                  tryi:
 27308 000020B9 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 27309 000020BE 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass

 27311                                  not_init_pass:
 27312 000020C3 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 27313                                          ; 11/12/2022

 27315 000020C8 74E5                    	je	short coff
 27316                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27317                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27318                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 27319                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 27320                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 27321                                  					; and before install= commands
 27322                                  					; are processed
 27323                                  
 27324 000020CA 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 27325 000020CF 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 27326 000020D1 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 27327                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27328                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 27329 000020D4 74D9                    	je	short coff
 27330                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27331                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27332                                  
 27333                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 27334                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 27335                                          
 27336 000020D6 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 27337                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27338 000020D9 7507                    	jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 27339                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 27345 000020E0 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 27346                                  
 27347                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27348                                  ; (SYSINIT:2448h)

 27350                                  ;%if 0
 27351                                  precheck_installhigh:

 27353 000020E5 756B                    	jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 27354                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27355 000020E7 800E[CE02]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27356 000020EC EBC1                    	jmp	short coff
 27357                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27358                                  
 27359                                  multi_try_i:

 27362 000020F1 750A                    	jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 27363                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27364                                  	;jne	short multi_pass_filter
 27365                                  
 27366                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27367                                  ;%if 1 
 27368                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27369                                  ;%if 0
 27370                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27371 000020F3 E8A31F                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27372 000020F6 7241                    	jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27373                                  ;endif

 27375

 27383                                  ;%if 0
 27384

 27386 000020FD 80FC57                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 27387 00002100 7537                            jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 27388                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27389 00002102 E8941F                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27390 00002105 7232                            jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27391                                  ;endif
 27392                                  
 27393                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 27394                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 27395                                  
 27396 00002107 B80058                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 27397 0000210A CD21                    	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 27398 0000210C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 27399 0000210E 53                              push    bx                      ; save for the return
 27400                                  
 27401 0000210F 81CB8000                        or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 27402 00002113 B80158                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 27403 00002116 CD21                    	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 27404                                  
 27405 00002118 B80258                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 27406 0000211B CD21                            int     21h                     ; get link state
 27407 0000211D 30E4                            xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 27408 0000211F 50                              push    ax                      ; save for return
 27409

 27411 00002123 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1

 27413

 27415                                  
 27416 0000212B B80358                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 27417 0000212E 5B                              pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 27418 0000212F CD21                            int     21h
 27419 00002131 5B                              pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 27420 00002132 B80158                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 27421 00002135 CD21                            int     21h
 27422                                  
 27423                                  	;jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 27424                                  	; 01/01/2023
 27425 00002137 EBA7                    	jmp	short multi_pass_coff2
 27426                                  
 27427                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27428                                  
 27429                                  multi_pass_filter:
 27430 00002139 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?

 27433 00002141 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 27434 00002143 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM     ; '0' ; rem?

 27436

 27438 00002148 FF0E[5A03]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count
