 27448                                  ; buffer command
 27449                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27450                                  
 27451                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27452                                  ;									      *
 27453                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27454                                  ;									      *
 27455                                  ; input :								      *
 27456                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27457                                  ; output:								      *
 27458                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27459                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27460                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27461                                  ;									      *
 27462                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27463                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27464                                  ; logic:								      *
 27465                                  ; {									      *
 27466                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27467                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27468                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27469                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27470                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27471                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27472                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27473                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27474                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27475                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27476                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27477                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27478                                  ;	};								      *
 27479                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27480                                  ; };									      *
 27481                                  ;									      *
 27482                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27483                                  
 27484                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27485                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27486                                  tryb:
 27487 00002152 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27488 00002155 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27489                                  
 27490                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27491                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)

 27493                                  ;%if 0
 27494                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 27496 0000215A 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27497                                  ;endif
 27498                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27499                                  
 27500                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27501                                  	; 18/12/2022

 27505

 27508                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27509                                  	;mov	dx,cx

 27513                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.

 27519 0000216A E9A606                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27520                                  if7:
 27521 0000216D 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27522 00002170 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27523                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x ; (/X switch)
 27524 00002172 813E[711D][661D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 27525                                  	;jne	short if11

 27550                                  ;	jne	short if18

 27554 0000219C EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 27555                                  if18:
 27556 0000219E A1[691D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.

 27573                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27574                                  ; break command
 27575                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27576                                  
 27577                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27578                                  ;									    *
 27579                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27580                                  ;									    *
 27581                                  ; input :								    *
 27582                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27583                                  ; output:								    *
 27584                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27585                                  ;									    *
 27586                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27587                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27588                                  ; logic:								    *
 27589                                  ; {									    *
 27590                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27591                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27592                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27593                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27594                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27595                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27596                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27597                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27598                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27599                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27600                                  ;	};								    *
 27601                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27602                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27603                                  ; };									    *
 27604                                  ;									    *
 27605                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27606                                  
 27607                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27608                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 27609                                  tryc:
 27610 000021B3 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27611 000021B6 7539                    	jne	short trym
 27612                                  
 27613                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27614                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 27615                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27616                                  ;%if 0
 27617                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27618 000021B8 E8DE1E                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 27619 000021BB 7234                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27620                                  ;endif
 27621                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27622                                  
 27623 000021BD BF[771D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 27624 000021C0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27625                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27626                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27627                                  do22:
 27628 000021C2 E81F07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27629 000021C5 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 27630                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 27631                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 27632                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27633                                  ;sr22:
 27634                                  	;jmp	coff
 27635                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27636 000021C7 E94906                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27637                                  if22:
 27638 000021CA 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 27639 000021CD 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 27640                                  
 27641                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 27642 000021CF 803E[701D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 27643 000021D4 7507                    	jne	short if26
 27644                                  
 27645 000021D6 C606[9C1D]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on

 27651                                  en26:

 27653                                  en22:

 27657 000021EC CD21                    	int	21h
 27658                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27659                                  	;jmp	short sr22
 27660                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27661                                  sr22:

 28646                                  ;;;;	ifdef	dblspace_hooks
 28647                                  ;
 28648                                  ;;	Now check for two special MagicDrv cases:
 28649                                  ;;
 28650                                  ;;       a) the last driver load was MagicDrv final placement:
 28651                                  ;;	   -> add number of MagicDrv reserved drives to drivenumber
 28652                                  ;;
 28653                                  ;;       b) MagicDrv is currently in temporary home:
 28654                                  ;;          -> call it to give it a chance to mount and shuffle drives
 28655                                  ;
 28656                                  ;	cmp	byte [cs:MagicHomeFlag],0 ; already home?
 28657                                  ;	jnz	short no_more_magic_calls ;  nothing more to do if so
 28658                                  ;
 28659                                  ;;	Now inquire of driver whether it is present, and final located
 28660                                  ;

 28666                                  ;

 28668                                  ;	jnz	short magic_not_yet_home ;  skip if not
 28669                                  ;
 28670                                  ;;	Okay, now the driver is final placed!  Set the flag so we
 28671                                  ;;	don't keep checking it, and add its number of drive letters
 28672                                  ;;	to drivenumber.

 28676                                  ;;					;  the drive number we'll pass to the

 28679                                  ;	jmp	short no_more_magic_calls ; and finished.
 28680                                  ;

 29187                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29188                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29189                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29190                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29191                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29192                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29193                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29194                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29195                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29196                                  
 29197                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29198                                  ;									  *
 29199                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29200                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29201                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29202                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29203                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29204                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29205                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29206                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29207                                  ; input :								  *
 29208                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29209                                  ; output:								  *
 29210                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29211                                  ;									  *
 29212                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29213                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29214                                  ; logic:								  *
 29215                                  ; {									  *
 29216                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29217                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29218                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29219                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29220                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29221                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29222                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29223                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29224                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29225                                  ;	     }								  *
 29226                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29227                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29228                                  ;	};								  *
 29229                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29230                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29231                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29232                                  ; };									  *
 29233                                  ;**************************************************************************

 29981                                  
 29982                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29983                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29984                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 29985                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29986                                  ;
 29987                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29988                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29989                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29990                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29991                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29992                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29993                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29994                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29995                                  ;	 procedure.
 29996                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29997                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29998                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29999                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand

 30348                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30349                                  ;
 30350                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30351                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30352                                  ;
 30353                                  ;	Output : none
 30354                                  ;
 30355                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30356                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30357                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30358                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30359                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 30368                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30369 0000298C E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30370 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30371                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30372                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30373                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30374                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12h as end of UMB

 30378 00002996 74F0                    	je	short limx

 30381                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 30389                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30390                                  ;
 30391                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30392                                  ;
 30393                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30394                                  ;	Output : none
 30395                                  ;
 30396                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30397                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30398                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30399                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30400                                  ;
 30401                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30402                                  
 30403                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30404                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30405 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 30406 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30407 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30408 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30409 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30410 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30411 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30412 000029AE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30413 000029B1 2EC606[7E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30414 000029B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30415                                  ;limx:
 30416 000029B8 C3                      	retn
 30417                                  
 30418                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30419                                  ;
 30420                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30421                                  ;
 30422                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30423                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30424                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30425                                  ;
 30426                                  ;	Output : none
 30427                                  ;
 30428                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30429                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30430                                  ;
 30431                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30432                                  
 30433                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30434                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30435                                  	; ds = cs
 30436 000029B9 803E[7E1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0

 30438                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30439                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30440 000029BE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30441                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30442 000029C0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30443 000029C3 8826[7E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30444                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30445                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30446 000029C7 1E                      	push	ds
 30447                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30448 000029C8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30449 000029CA 2EA1[7F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]

 30451 000029D1 1F                      	pop	ds

 30453 000029D2 C3                      	retn

 30506                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30507                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30508                                  
 30509                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30510                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30511                                  
 30512                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30513                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30514                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30515                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30516                                  
 30517                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30518                                  ;
 30519                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30520                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30521                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30522                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30523                                  ;
 30524                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30525                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30526                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30527                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30528                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30529                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30530                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30531                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30532                                  ; available during the load.
 30533                                  ;
 30534                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30535                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30536                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30537                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30538                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30539                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30540                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30541                                  ;
 30542                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30543                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30544                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30545                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30546                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30547                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30548                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30549                                  ;
 30550                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30551                                  
 30552                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30553                                  
 30554                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30555                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30556                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30557                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30558                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30559                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30560                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30561                                  
 30562                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30563                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30564                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30565                                  
 30566                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30567                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30568                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30569                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30570                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30571                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30572                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30573                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30574                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30575                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30576                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30577                                  
 30578                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30579                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30580                                  
 30581                                  InitVar:
 30582                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30583                                  	; ds = cs
 30584                                  
 30585                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30586                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30587                                  	;push	ax
 30588                                  	;push	cx
 30589                                  	;push	di
 30590 000029FD 06                      	push	es
 30591                                  
 30592                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30593 000029FE 0E                      	push	cs
 30594 000029FF 07                      	pop	es
 30595                                  
 30596 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30597                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30598                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30599                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30600                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30601                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30602                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30603                                  
 30604                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30605                                  	; ds = cs
 30606 00002A02 A2[261F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30607 00002A05 A2[251F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30608 00002A08 A3[271F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30609 00002A0B C606[291F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30610                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30611 00002A10 A2[5C1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30612                                  
 30613 00002A13 FC                      	cld
 30614                                  
 30615 00002A14 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30616 00002A17 BF[2A1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30617 00002A1A F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30618                                  
 30619                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30620                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30621 00002A1C B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30622 00002A1E BF[3A1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30623 00002A21 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30624                                  
 30625                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30626                                  
 30627                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30628 00002A23 07                      	pop	es
 30629                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30630                                  	;pop	di
 30631                                  	;pop	cx
 30632                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30633                                  
 30634 00002A24 C3                      	retn
 30635                                  
 30636                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30637                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30638                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30639                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30640                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30641                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30642                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30643                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30644                                  
 30645                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30646                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30647                                  FixMem:
 30648                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30649                                  	;push	ax
 30650                                  	;push	bx
 30651                                  	;push	cx
 30652                                  	;push	dx
 30653 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 30654                                  
 30655 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30656                                  
 30657 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30658 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30659                                  
 30660 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30661                                  
 30662                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30663                                  
 30664 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30665 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30666 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30667                                  
 30668                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30669                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30670                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30671                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30672                                  
 30673 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30674 00002A39 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30675 00002A3E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30676 00002A40 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30677                                  
 30678                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30679                                  
 30680 00002A42 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30681 00002A47 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30682 00002A49 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30683                                  
 30684 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30685                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30686                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30687 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 30688 00002A53 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30689                                  
 30690                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30691                                  
 30692 00002A58 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Save MCB address
 30693 00002A5A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30694                                  
 30695 00002A5F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30696                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 30697 00002A61 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30698 00002A66 43                      	inc	bx
 30699 00002A67 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30700                                  
 30701                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30702 00002A69 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30703 00002A6B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30704                                  fmX:	
 30705 00002A6D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30706                                  
 30707 00002A70 07                      	pop	es
 30708                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30709                                  	;pop	dx
 30710                                  	;pop	cx
 30711                                  	;pop	bx
 30712                                  	;pop	ax
 30713                                  
 30714 00002A71 C3                      	retn
 30715                                  
 30716                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30717                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30718                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30719                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30720                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30721                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30722                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30723                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30736                                  	;pop	es
 30737                                  	
 30738                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30739                                  	; ds = cs
 30740                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30741 00002A77 A2[5A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30742                                  
 30743 00002A7A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30744 00002A7D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30745 00002A80 CD21                    	int	21h
 30746 00002A82 C3                      	retn

 30750                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30775 00002A8C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h

 30780                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30781                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30782                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30783                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30784                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30785                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30786                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30787                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30788                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30789                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30790                                  ;
 30791                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30792                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30793                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30794                                  ;
 30795                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30796                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30797                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30798                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30799                                  ;
 30800                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30801                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30802                                  ;
 30803                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30804                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30805                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30806                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30807                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30808                                  ;     lh
 30809                                  ;     /l
 30810                                  ;     1
 30811                                  ;     1000
 30812                                  ;     2
 30813                                  ;     print
 30814                                  ;     /d
 30815                                  ;     :lpt2
 30816                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30817                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30818                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30819                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30820                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30821                                  ; for:
 30822                                  ;    Each /L
 30823                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30824                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30825                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30826                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30827                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30828                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30829                                  
 30830                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30831                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30832                                  
 30833                                  ParseVar:
 30834                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30835                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30836                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30837 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 30838 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 30839                                  
 30840 00002A91 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30841 00002A92 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30842 00002A93 FC                      	cld
 30843                                  
 30844                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30845                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30846                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30847                                  
 30848 00002A94 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30849 00002A95 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30850 00002A98 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30851                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30852 00002A9A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30853 00002A9C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30854                                  
 30855 00002A9E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30856 00002A9F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30857 00002AA0 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30858                                  pv20:	
 30859 00002AA2 AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30860                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30861 00002AA3 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30862                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30863 00002AA5 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30864 00002AA7 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30865                                  
 30866                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30867 00002AA9 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30868                                  
 30869                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30870                                  	;
 30871                                  	;push	es
 30872                                  	;push	cs
 30873                                  	;pop	es
 30874                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30875                                  	;pop	es
 30876                                  
 30877 00002AAE 2EC606[261F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30878                                  
 30879 00002AB4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30880                                  
 30881                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30882 00002AB6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 30883 00002AB8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 30884                                  
 30885                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30886 00002ABA 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30887                                  
 30888 00002ABF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30889 00002AC2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30890                                  
 30891 00002AC4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30892 00002AC5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30893                                  
 30894                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30895 00002AC7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30896 00002ACA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30897 00002ACB 4E                      	dec	si
 30898 00002ACC F9                      	stc
 30899                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30900 00002ACD 07                      	pop	es
 30901 00002ACE 1F                      	pop	ds
 30902                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30903                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30904 00002ACF C3                      	retn
 30905                                  
 30906                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30907                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30908                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30909                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30910                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30911                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30912                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30913                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30914                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30915                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30916                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax. The 3-character rewind
 30917                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30918                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30919                                  
 30920                                  parseL:
 30921 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 30922 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30923 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30924                                  
 30925                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30926                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30927                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30928                                  
 30929 00002AD5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, it's ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30930 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30931 00002ADA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30932                                  
 30933 00002ADD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30934 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30935 00002AE2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30936                                  
 30937                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30938 00002AE4 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30939                                  
 30940 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 30941 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30942 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30943                                  
 30944 00002AEE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30945 00002AF1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30946                                  
 30947 00002AF3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30948 00002AF6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30949                                  
 30950                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30951 00002AF8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30952 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30953                                  
 30954 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30955 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30956                                  
 30957                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30958                                  
 30959 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30960 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30961                                  
 30962 00002B05 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30963                                  
 30964 00002B08 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30965                                  
 30966                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30967 00002B0B 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30968                                  
 30969 00002B10 AC                      	lodsb
 30970 00002B11 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30971 00002B13 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30972                                  
 30973 00002B15 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30974 00002B18 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30975                                  
 30976 00002B1A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30977 00002B1D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30978                                  
 30979                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30980 00002B1F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30981 00002B21 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30982                                  plE1:	
 30983                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30984 00002B23 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30985 00002B26 4E                      	dec	si
 30986 00002B27 F9                      	stc
 30987 00002B28 C3                      	retn
 30988                                  
 30989                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30990 00002B29 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30991                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30992                                  	; cf=1
 30993                                  	;stc
 30994 00002B2C C3                      	retn
 30995                                  plSwX:	
 30996 00002B2D 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 30997                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30998                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 30999                                  	; cf=0
 31000                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 31001 00002B2E C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 31002                                  
 31003                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31004                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 31005                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31006                                  ; ENTRY:    None

 31008                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31009                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 31010                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31011                                  
 31012                                  ;incArgc:

 31014

 31018

 31020

 31022

 31024                                  
 31025                                  	;pop	ax
 31026                                  	;retn
 31027                                  
 31028                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31029                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31030                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31031                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31032                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31033                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31034                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31035                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31036                                  
 31037                                  isEOL:
 31038 00002B2F 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 31039 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31040 00002B33 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31041 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31042 00002B37 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31043                                  ieX:	
 31044 00002B39 C3                      	retn
 31045                                  
 31046                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31047                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 31048                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31049                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31050                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31051                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31052                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31053                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31054                                  
 31055                                  isWhite:
 31056 00002B3A 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 31057 00002B3C 7406                    	je	short iwX
 31058 00002B3E 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 31059 00002B40 7402                    	je	short iwX
 31060 00002B42 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 31061                                  iwX:	
 31062 00002B44 C3                      	retn
 31063                                  
 31064                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31065                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 31066                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31115                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31116                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31117                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31118                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31119                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31120                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31121                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31122                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31123                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31124                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31125                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31126                                  
 31127                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31128                                  stowUMB:
 31129 00002B58 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31130 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31131 00002B5C F9                      	stc
 31132 00002B5D C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB # >= MAXUMB
 31133                                  su10:	
 31134                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31135                                  	;push	bx
 31136                                  	;push	di
 31137                                  	;push	si
 31138                                  	;push	ds
 31139                                  	;push	es
 31140                                  	;push	cs
 31141                                  	;pop	es
 31142                                  	;push	cs
 31143                                  	;pop	ds
 31144                                  
 31145                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31146                                  	; ds <> cs
 31147                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31148 00002B5E 2E803E[291F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31149                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31150 00002B64 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31151 00002B66 2EA2[291F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31152                                  
 31153                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31154                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31155                                  	;jne	short su20
 31156                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31157                                  su20:	
 31158 00002B6A 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31159 00002B6C 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 31160                                  
 31161                                  	;mov	bl,al
 31162                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 31163                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 31164                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31165 00002B6E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 31166 00002B70 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 31167 00002B72 B001                    	mov	al,1
 31168                                  
 31169                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31170                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31171 00002B74 2E8687[2A1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31172                                  
 31173                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 31174                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 31175                                  	;
 31176                                  	;stc			; OOOPS! This one's been used before. :(
 31177                                  	
 31178                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31179 00002B79 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 31180 00002B7B F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31181                                  su30:	
 31182                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31183                                  	;pop	es
 31184                                  	;pop	ds
 31185                                  	;pop	si
 31186                                  	;pop	di
 31187                                  	;pop	bx
 31188 00002B7C C3                      	retn
 31189                                  
 31190                                  ; 08/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 31191                                  %if 0
